loans.name: Kumboedza Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 54 years old, married and has three children.  She is from Masvingo. Rosemary runs an agriculture business raising and selling chickens, which she has been doing for five years. Her main challenge is that of chicks dying due to cold whether. 

Rosemary is requesting a loan for $800, which she will use to buy chicks and improve the fowl run. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family.  In the future, Rosemary plans to be the number one chicken supplier in Masvingo.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and improve the fowl run

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 58 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos , actualmente vive en su casa propia con su hija menor.La actividad que realiza Teresa es la venta de dulces caseros como rosquitas, panes, suspiros dulces, entre otros. Diariamente acondiciona su puesto de venta en el mercado de la ciudad cerca de su vivienda. Sus ventas son por unidades en pequeñas bolsas o en cantidades al por mayor ya sea por kilos o por docenas. En ocasiones sus ventas son muy buenas ya que logra vender todo lo que ofrece durante el día.Inició esta labor hace 15 años y gracias a ello a podido brindarles a sus hijos mayores una buena educación.Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias económicas que percibe constantemente. Ahora espera obtener un puesto de ventas más amplio en donde ofrezca una mayor cantidad de sus exquisitos productos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles y está contenta de saber que tiene el apoyo financiero necesario para continuar con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado comprará los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus dulces como harinas, azúcar, levadura, leche, huevos y aceite.
texts.en:
Teresa, 58, is a single mother of four children. She lives with her youngest daughter in a house they own. Teresa sells home-made sweets, such as doughnuts, bread and meringue. She sets her stall every day in the city’s marketplace, close to where she lives. She sells by the unit (in small bags) or in bulk (by weight or by the dozen). Sometimes, her sales are very good and she manages to sell everything she made. Teresa started this business fifteen years ago and thanks to that, she has been able to give her oldest children a good education. Teresa thinks that her business is profitable, and that she receives the benefits on a frequent manner.

Teresa hopes now to have a larger stall and offer larger quantities of her delicious products. This time she is requesting 800 nuevos soles [PEN]. She feels happy knowing that she has the financial support needed to continue working. With this amount, she will buy the ingredients needed to prepare sweets, such as different types of flour, sugar, yeast, milk, eggs and oil.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as flour, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en: Ghaith is a 19-year-old single guy living with his parents and his brother and sister. Ghaith started his own independent business by renting a small store and turning it into a small café where he serves snacks and hot drinks. He wants to add more seats and tables, and serve more types of hot drinks other than tea and coffee. For that he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to add more seats and tables, and to serve more types of hot drinks other than tea and coffee.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 25-year-old single lady. She is the oldest sister in the family. Alaa goes to the university in the daytime to study for her bachelor degree, and in the evenings she works in a video and photography shop where she goes to parties to film their special moments. 

Now Alaa is applying for an educational loan to help her pay her summer semester fees.

loans.use: To pay her summer semester fees.

loans.name: Gul's Group

texts.en:
Gul is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a welding shop. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. 

Currently, he is in need of purchasing iron rods, iron sheets, etc., to manufacture doors and windows. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Gul as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needful things for her husband's shop. 

She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase iron rods, iron sheets, etc., to manufacture doors and windows.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gina is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is the second child of five siblings. He is a high school graduate and still single. Warlito cultivates rice on one hectare of land. He has been in this kind of business for 15 years. Aside from this, he is also into the livestock business, wherein he raises two cows.

Warlito wants to continue to grow his rice farming business; that's why he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticides to improve his rice farming business. He knows that this loan will allow him to further improve his rice crop production and to have a viable source of income. Warlito is looking forward to the approval of his requested loan amount so he can sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticides to improve his rice farming business.

loans.name: Women's Hope Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Susan from Masvingo. She is widowed with one child, who is attending school. Susan runs a clothing business which sells clothes and blankets. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge she is facing is that of competitors selling the same products at unprofitable prices. Susan has requested a loan of $1,200 to buy winter clothes and blankets. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her an increase her disposable income and thereby improve family welfare. In the future, Susan plans to own two shops.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes and blankets.

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en: While Ndue has expressed his deep gratitude for the financial help that he received from Kiva lenders, he is back now seeking your help again. This time he wants to buy a cow. With the previous loan, he was able to buy certain tools needed in his welding business that so far has been going well, according to him.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 30-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and two children. Her husband is a janitor by profession and he has a very low monthly income, so they are facing a lot of financial problems.

Ruqia is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work for 15 years. Her clients are very happy and well satisfied with her work.
 
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring centre in her house. She would purchase two new sewing machines so that her production would be increased. She would also purchase some threads and cloth. She would pay her installments with the profits and also pay some household expenses. She is very hopeful that the loan will help her family to progress.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has one child. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is 37 years old and married with two children.

Rosenie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosenie requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosenie has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 36 years old, married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Irenea has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Irenea has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Irenea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 50 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisca has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Francisca is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Walayat's Group

texts.en:
Walayat  is 46 years old and a married woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a spice shop which is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. 

Presently, he is in need of purchasing spices for his shop that include chili, ginger, cinnamon, parsley, thyme, cumin, rosemary, saffron, turmeric, and crushed red pepper flakes. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Walayat as a member of a 3-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needful things for her husband's shop. 

Her husband's work depends upon electricity because he has to grind the spices for sale and there is a huge loadshedding issue (regular power outages) in the area. Walayat prays that this issue will soon resolve so that her husband can continue his work efficiently. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria lives in the Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya. This is a very fertile area known for its productivity and located at the slopes of Mount Kenya. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

She has been doing farming for seven years. Her source of income is coffee, bananas, maize and beans. The challenges she faces are poor markets, pests and diseases.

She wants to venture into poultry farming and so has requested a loan of KES 40,000 to enable her do that. The proceeds she receives from this loan will enable her to give good-quality educations to her children. 

In the next five years, she will rear over one hundred layers. Asteria says that with Juhudi Kilimo, she will maximize on egg production since their funds are affordable.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Masimba Kuwanda Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Loveness from Masvingo. She is married with three children; two of them are attending school.  Loveness runs a food business baking buns and bread. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge faced is that of small oven capacity to meet the demand for buns and bread. 

Loveness has requested a loan of $300 to  purchase baking pans and baking flour. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future Loveness plans to build her own building for the bakery.

loans.use: to purchase baking pans and flour

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya, located on the slopes of Mount Kenya. She is married and has four children of whom two are still in school. She has practiced farming for four years. Her main sources of income are: bananas, maize, beans, cassavas, and coffee.

She has requested a loan of KES.20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase farm inputs. Her major challenge is dry spells. The returns from this loan will help her provide advanced education for her children.

In the next five years, she will have raised high grade dairy cows for milk production.

Lucy says that Juhudi Kilimo has enabled her to improve her way of farming.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Virgencita

texts.en:
Virgencita  is a 51-year-old woman who is married and has three children. To make a living, she owns a farm located in their community of Gango, Ozamiz City, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been farming bananas for six years, earning 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

As a member of GDMPC microcredit since 2011, she borrowed 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure and to pay for the post-harvest labor costs. She plans to purchase another lot from the revenue of her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and to pay the post-harvest labor costs.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is 71 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, noodles, and other groceries. 

Ludmila is requesting a loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell at her store. In the future, Ludmila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asima's Group

texts.en:
Asima, 31, is a married woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of 4 children. She lives in a rural area, and her children do not have proper place for playing. She belongs to a middle class family.

Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a small restaurant which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household 's needs. Presently, he is in need of crockery like plates, spoons, glasses, and jugs for the restaurant. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Asima, as a member of 3-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase these items for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will help her husband. 

She wants to provide a quality education to her children. She hopes that she can prove herself a successful mother. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture Asima, is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase crockery for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Klodjan

texts.en:
Klodjan is a 23-year-old single young man living in rural southern Albania who is seeking lenders' attention. He wants to add some more goats of a good breed to his family’s existing goat herd. Klodjan’s parents have been in the animal husbandry activity since the collapse of the regime. They have been doing very well, according to them.

 “Now that I am a grownup man, I thought that I could take over from my parents and be the one responsible for the whole activity. I want to reach to 100 goats, and this is my definite goal for the future. Growing up and watching my parents taking care of animals, I grew up to love animals, too, and especially goats. So all in all, I love this activity and I get so much joy from it," Klodjan ended.

loans.use: To add some more goats to his existing goat herd.

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Phillis lives in Nkubu in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya, located on the slopes of Mt.Kenya. This is a very productive area. She is a widowed mother of 4 children. She has been doing farming for 50 years. Her source of income is milk, coffee, bananas, maize, and beans.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to construct a zero grazing unit for her dairy cows. This loan will provide more food for her family. The challenge she faces is unreliable markets for the products.

In the next five years, she will buy some more high-producing dairy cows. 

She says that Juhudi Kilimo has enabled her ventures in farming, especially dairy farming.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a resident of Alinam, Cauayan City. He is 51 years old and married with two children. To finance the daily expenditures of his family, Antonio engages in farming activities. He has been into this business for almost 30 years now. Through this, he is generating a net income of 35,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per cropping or every harvest season. Antonio harvests rice two times a year. 

To further generate more income to supplement his family needs, Antonio wants to avail a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP for him to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. He is hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can utilize it on his agricultural business.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with five children; three are in school.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, noodles and other groceries.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred is 58 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Meldred is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Meldred has been raising pigs for 33 years and also earns additional income from a beauty parlor.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: El Moralito Group

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 45 años de edad, es originaria de una población rica en historia, costumbres donde se come bien, Elena es parte de un grupo de personas las cuales piden créditos para mejorar sus negocios, su grupo se llama el Moralito, y dice que le dieron ese nombre porque así se llama la colonia donde se reúnen una vez por semana para hacer sus pagos. Ella ya tiene varios ciclos trabajando con Visión Fund y dice que le gusta estar en esta financiera porque es seria y respeta a sus clientes. Desde pequeña ella creció ayudándole a trabajar a sus padres en un puesto de venta de fresas con crema, papas fritas y a la francesa, chicharrones preparados, pancakes, plátanos preparados, churros rellenos de diferentes sabores, su puesto lo ponen donde hay ferias o fiestas patronales de las comunidades y de su misma población. 
Dice que desde hace 8 años decidió poner su propio negocio para también ella sacar adelante a su familia, tiene dos niños los cuales estudian la primaria y su esposo es empleado pero a veces le ayuda a ella en el negocio de las frituras y antojitos. Elena esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de los insumos que ocupa para hacer y realizar sus antojitos dice que comprara harina, azúcar, chantillí, plátanos, leche condensada, leche evaporada, huevo, cajeta, mermelada de diferentes frutas, chocolate, fresas, gas, papas, aceite, entre otras cosas. Platica que su sueño es hacer un poco mas grande su puesto ya que a veces no le caben las cosas que vende, ella también quisiera comprar un refrigerador un poco mas grande para meter sus productos y que no se le echen a perder. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Juana Guadalupe, Rosa Isela, María Felicitas, Oliva, Ana Laura, María Virginia, Ana Lilia, Beatriz, Pablo y María Isabel, ellos invertirán en sus negocios de venta por catalogo de perfumería, cosméticos, surtir ropa interior para su venta, para la compra de insumos para elaborar pan para su venta, para surtir una tienda de abarrotes, para la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos y postres, para la compra de perfumería, cosméticos por catalogo y para compra de juguetes para su venta.
texts.en:
María Elena is 45 years old.  She is from a town which is steeped in history and tradition, where people eat well.  Elena is part of a group of people who are requesting loans to improve their businesses.  Her group is called Moralito and she says that they named the group after the neighborhood where they meet once a week to make their loan repayments.  Elena has participated in several loan cycles with Visión Fund and she says that she likes belonging to this financial institution because it is serious and respects its clients.  

Elena grew up helping her parents on their stall selling strawberries and cream, fries, fried pork rinds, pancakes, prepared plantains, different flavors of filled churros, etc.  They would set up their stall wherever there were open air markets or public celebrations in surrounding communities and also in their own town.  She says that eight years ago she decided to set up her own business so that she could provide for her family.  She has two children who are currently in elementary school.  Her husband is an employee but sometimes helps her out in her business selling fried food and snacks.  

Elena is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her snacks.  She says that she will buy flour, sugar, cream, plantains, condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, caramel, different flavors of jam, chocolate, strawberries, gas, potatoes, oil and other products.  She says that her dream is to increase the size of her stall a little because sometimes she is unable to fit in everything that she sells.  She would also like to buy a slightly larger refrigerator to put her products in so that they don't go off.

The other members of this group are called Juana Guadalupe, Rosa Isela, María Felicitas, Oliva, Ana Laura, María Virginia, Ana Lilia, Beatriz, Pablo and María Isabel.  They will invest in their businesses selling perfumes and cosmetics through catalogs, selling underwear, baking bread to sell, running a grocery store, making snacks and deserts, and selling toys.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cream, bananas, condensed milk, milk, eggs, caramel, different flavors of jam, chocolate, strawberries, gas, potatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Harukooto Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 62-year-old married woman with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a team leader who inspires her group members to work hard and make their future better through their entrepreneurial skills. 

Jane has a grocery store where she sells a wide range of food items and firewood. With the money she earns she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her major challenge is lack of preservation equipment for the perishable goods. Jane used the previous loan to buy sweet bananas and soda to sell. She will use this loan to buy firewood to sell. Her dreams are to operate a wholesale business and to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна   родилась в Канибадаме. После окончания школы поступила в университет, и закончила на хорошо. После вышла замуж. Но ревнивый муж не дал ей работать. Она смерилась с этим, ведь семья важнее карьеры. Они были счастливы.  Но   ее мужу пришлось уехать в Россию и зарабатывать там на жизнь так как сдесь он не смог найти достойную работу с хорошей заработной платой.   Мавзуна осталась с двумя детьми. Младшему было еще год. И ей пришлось самой работать дома, и как то зарабатывать на жизнь. Она начала дома печь лепешки, булочки и всякие сладости и  продавала  местным магазинам.  И в замен покупала муку и другие ингредиенты.   Этим она увеличила доходность своего бизнеса.   Сейчас она уже профессиональный  пекарь. Она в местном рынке открыла личную прилавку для продажи сладостей. А сейчас ей надо купить большую  печь, для улучшения качества ее булочек. Для этого она и обратилась в «Арванд».  Мавзуна  очень рада с помощью кредита в Арванде она сможет иметь большой доход и улучшить свои условия проживания.
texts.en: Mavzuna was born in Kanibadam.  She enrolled in university after finishing school and finished with good marks.  She got married afterwards, but her jealous husband would not allow her to work.  Mavzuna resigned herself to the fact that family is more important than a career.  They were happy, but her husband had to leave for Russia to find work, as he wasn't able to find good work with a decent salary at home.  Mavzuna was left with two children, the youngest of whom was only a year old, and she had to work at home herself and also find money on which to live.  She began to bake pastries, buns and all kinds of sweets at home to sell to local shops, and in return bought flour and other ingredients.  In this way, she increased the income of her business.  Now Mavzuna is already a professional baker.  She has opened her own stall at the local market to sell her sweets, and now she needs to buy a big oven so improve the quality of her buns.  She has turned to Arvand for this.  Mavzuna is very happy that, with the help of a loan from Arvand, she is able to have a decent income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru: Азиз 23-х летний молодой мужчина. Он женат и живет со своей женой у родителей в городе Исфара. Азиз год занимался торговлей сухофруктов в России. Теперь он хочет работать в своей родине и начать здесь торговый бизнес. Он запрашивает кредит для постройки продуктового магазина по месту своего проживания. У него имеется часть строительных материалов (песок, цемент). На сумму кредита Азиз хочет нанять мастеров по ремонту и закупить недостающие материалы для строительства и отделки магазина. У Азиза есть сбережения, накопленные за счет торговли сухофруктами. На сумму сбережения Азиз планирует закупить принадлежности для магазина - холодильник, стеллаж и т.д., а также продукты питания для продажи. В селе, где живет Азиз не имеется продуктового магазина, в основном там киоски и лавки с малым ассортиментом товара и высокими ценами на них, что даёт ему большое преимущество(сниженную конкурентность). В торговле Азизу будет помогать жена. Азиз очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Aziz is a young man of 23 years who is married and lives with his wife and parents in the city of Isfara.  He spent a year selling dried fruits in Russia, and now he wants to work in his own country and start his own business there.  He is asking for a loan to construct a shop near where he lives.  Aziz already has part of the building materials (sand, cement), but he plans to use the loan to hire construction workers and to buy the building materials and shop fittings he is missing.  He has some savings that he started from his work abroad, and he plans to use that to buy furnishings for the shop - a refrigerator, shelves, etc, as well as products to sell.  The village where Aziz lives does not have a market other than kiosks and shops with a small assortment of goods at high prices.  This gives him a good advantage, as there is less competition.  Aziz's wife will help him in the shop.  He is counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for a shop.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en: Shareefan, 45, is a married woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 6 children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns general store, which is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household's needs. Presently, he needs to purchase flour, wheat, pulse, eggs, soap, detergent, sugar, rice and other items for his shop. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Shareefan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the things needed in her husband's shop. Shareefan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase flour, wheat, pulse, eggs, soap, detergent, sugar, rice, and other product for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Djiba's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 17 Mai 2007 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Djiba (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 43 ans et mère de sept enfants : trois garçons et quatre filles. Son activité consiste à acheter des fruits auprès des villageois pour la vente au marché communale. Au retour elle achète du riz, du savon qu’elle revend au détail dans le village.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  cinq paniers de mangues et pour le retour au village elle espère prendre deux sacs de riz à 30 000 F CFA  et cinq cartons de savon  30 000 F CFA.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la  scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on May 17, 2007 at the inauguration of the 'banc villageois', this group is composed of women who have experience in 'banc villageois' programs. The women are all from the same village and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Djiba (seated at the far right in the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married, 43 years old, and the mother of seven children: 3 boys and 4 girls. Her business involves purchasing fruit from villagers to sell at the communal market. On the way back, she purchases rice and soap that she sells retail in the village. 

With her new loan, she plans on purchasing 5 baskets of mangoes. And on the way back to the village, she hopes to get 2 sacks of rice at 30,000 francs CFA and 5 boxes of soap at 30,000 francs.

She intends to use the profits to help her husband cover the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, rice, and soap

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Julia Mercedes tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de madera. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera.  
(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julia Mercedes is 28 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She is a hard-working, entrepreneurial person who is making progress in life.  Her main business is selling wood.  She has belonged to the Chacoq community bank for several years and needs this current loan to buy wood. 

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es: Cosme, tiene la edad  de 64 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras  condiciones que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Cosme is 64 years old and lives with his children and wife who are his main priority in life.  He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay workers to carry out some work on his coffee plants.  He will also buy some nursery plants so that he can do some resowing at the beginning of the rainy season.  This will help him to increase his plant density and he will be able to make the most of the good fertility of the soil, the climatic conditions and other conditions that favor coffee growing.  With these improvements in place, he hopes to make a little profit and thereby improve his family's living conditions.  He will also invest a little more in his crops and achieve some goals.  

This is Cosme's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has never received any loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay workers

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 56 years old, married, and has one child.  She is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she owns a general store selling home products and school and office supplies. She earns 40,000 PHP a month. 

Anselma is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy school and office supplies for the coming school opening. In the future, she plans to expand her business to have a better future for her child.

loans.use: to purchase school and office supplies for the coming school opening

loans.name: Begimniso

texts.ru:
Бегимнисо, женшина в возрасте 34 лет, предприниматель, занимается купля продажей женской  и детской одежды на центральном рынке Дж. Расуловского района.  Она замужем, имеет троих детей, сына и две дочки. Муж летом ездит в РТ на заработки а в остальные времена года, работает в своем районе разнорабочим.  Не надеясь только на доход своего мужа  Бегимнисо начала свою деятельность в 2000 году.  Она начала свое дело с 500tjs, было очень тяжело но с 2004 года Бегимнисо начала кредитоваться в Арванде и ее товарооборот постепенно увеличивался. Она намного улучшила свои условия проживания. За то время что Бегимнисо кредитовалась в Арванде она доказала свою ответственность и пунктуальность.
На данный момент Бегимнисо планирует увеличить свой ассортимент товара и  в очередной раз обратилась в Арванд. 
На полученный кредит она хочет закупить летний ассортимент товара и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Begimniso is a 34-year-old woman entrepreneur who buys and sells women's clothing at the central market of the Jabbor Rasulov region.  She is married with three children - one son and two daughters.  Her husband spends his summers working in the Russian Federation and he spends the rest of the time working on various odd jobs.  To avoid relying solely on the income of her husband, Begimniso started her own business in 2000.  Her business grew and she has now improved her living conditions considerably.  During the time that she has been a borrower with Arvand, she has shown herself to be responsible and punctual.  Now Begimniso plans on increasing her assortment of goods and she has again turned to Arvand.  On receiving her loan, she wants to buy a summer assortment of clothes to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy a summer range of women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Klara

texts.en: Klara is 26 years old, married, and the mother of a two-year-old child. She lives in south-eastern Albania. Since her early twenties, Klara has worked in agricultural with her husband. They plant veggies and sell them to the local market in a nearby city. Kindly note that Klara has been photographed here in the field that she uses to plant veggies and potatoes. The couple also works in their village’s church; doing mostly cleaning and landscaping. Klara is happy with their business and the income she generates from selling her fresh produce. Through this loan of ALL100,000, she will be able to buy some pesticides for her plants. She wants to thank Kiva lenders for their financial help to her and other people like her.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her plants.

loans.name: Suhbat

texts.en:
Mr.Suhbat is 61 years old and lives with his son in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His son, Tumenbayar, is 22 years old and helps him to run his business of manufacturing energy-efficient, economical stoves at home. 

Suhbat has been running his metal workshop since 1992. He is well-experienced in his occupation and well-known by his clients for his work. He is planning to build large amount of energy-efficient, economical stoves for Ger (Mongolian traditional Yurt) district citizens, to reduce air pollution and consumption of coal, during winter. 

Suhbat is now applying for loan of MNT 1,000,000 to purchase materials to build a large amount of energy-efficient, economical stoves. He is a hard-working, thoughtful, and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a large amount of energy-efficient, economical stoves.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Rica works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rica is borrowing PHP19,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport. Rica has been sustaining her business activities via her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport.

loans.name: Mendsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Mendsaikhan, 28 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a salesperson at a private business entity for two years. His wife has the position of manager at a private company. Besides his full-time job, Mendsaikhan also owns a rental public house and gets rental fees from the customers. 

Over the years, this public house hasn't received any repairs and residents began to complain about the house's condition. So, Mendsaikhan is requesting a loan of MNT 7,000,000 to purchase building and insulation materials and to change heating and sanitation systems. 

After the house's renovation, the renters will live in a comfortable and warm place, as well as reducing their coal consumption, releasing less pollutants, and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who cares for his customers' living conditions.

loans.use: to repair and insulate his public house.

loans.name: Donabegim

texts.ru: Донабегим жительница района Шахритуз. Ей 55 лет. Она вдова. Донабегим имеет одного взрослого сына, который сейчас находится в России на заработках. Донабегим живет одна. Она хочет начать бизнес в сфере торговли и заняться продажей одежды. Донабегим уже приобрела торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Она планирует оптом закупать товар с города Душанбе и продавать их по розничной цене на рынке своего района. С этой целью Донабегим запрашивает кредит для закупа одежды и тем самым начать свой торговый бизнес.
texts.en: Donabegim lives in the Shahrituz region.  She is 55 years old and she is a widow with one grown son who is now a migrant worker in Russia.  Donabegim lives alone.  She wants to start a business buying and selling women's clothes.  She has already secured a trading stall at the central market in her region.  She plans on buying her goods on a wholesale basis in Dushanbe and selling them for a good price at her regional market.  With this goal in mind, Donabegim is asking for a loan to buy women's clothes so she can start her retail business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a uno de sus hijos. Hace 14 años se dedica  a la venta de licuados de leche con frutas como melón, sandia, banano, manzana, piña y cereales. El negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación. Recibe otros ingresos por realizar trabajos de confección de ropa y también de enfermería. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de insumos como frutas y cereales para la elaboración de licuados y compra de medicinas naturales para vender. Su plan es ampliar el local del negocio para dar mejor servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
50-year-old Felipa is a single mother.  She has four children and lives with one of them in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  For 14 years, Felipa has been selling milk-based smoothies made with fruit such as melon, watermelon, banana, apple and pineapple, and cereals.  Her business is located in her home.  She makes additional income through making clothes and nursing.

Felipa is requesting a loan for 6,000 lempira to buy supplies such as fruit and cereals for making her smoothies.  She will also buy natural medicines to sell.  Her plan is to expand her business premises so that she can provide her customers with a better service.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fruit and cereals for making smoothies, and to buy natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of school-going age. She has practiced farming for 10 years. Her sources of income are: bananas, tea leaves, maize, beans, and milk.

She wants to purchase irrigation equipment and has thus requested a loan of KES.20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo. This loan will enable her to water her crops easily and thus increase her crop production and hence give her more income which she will use to better her children's education. The challenges she faces are: inadequate funds, pests and diseases.

In 5 years, she wants to put up a greenhouse with a variety of produce.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Dominick

texts.en:
Dominick is 30 years old and still single. He lives with his parents in a rural community and aims to become successful and financially stable in the future.

 With the desire to help his parents supply their daily needs, Dominick is engaged in a hog-raising business. He plans to improve the business and make it more profitable thus he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in his hog-raising business. Through hard work and strong determination, he believes that he can improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in his hog-raising business

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Mr.Nyamdorj is 54 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Purevdulam, is 52 years old, retired, and stays home taking care of her family. His son Bayarjargal is 27 years old and works at a local private company and his daughter Dulamsuren is 22 years old, a senior student at the university. 

Nyamdorj has been running a wooden furniture and 'ger' (Mongolian traditional yurt) business for years to cover his family expenses. His son started working and it became a lot of help for the family. Suhbat is now requesting a loan of 1,380,000 MNT to pay his daughter's university tuition fee. He is hardworking, enthusiastic and an optimistic man.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition fee

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is 30 years old. He lives in Marneuli District with his parents. Samir requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Samir is requesting a loan from Credo, which he will use to start a family business. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his loan, Samir will purchase a car. He will also purchase stock of groceries and household goods from the wholesalers and transport them by car to sell in nearby villages. He will work hard to earn a good income and help his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Ms.Tsetsegmaa is 54 years old lives with her husband and son in a small house in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Nadmidtseren, is 59 years old, retired and stays at home. Her son, Batsuran, is 20 years old and studies at university. Tsetsegmaa worked as a tailor in a local state-owned company for years and retired. She tailors clothes at home for her relatives and friends since she retired. She is now planning to make it a business and start her own tailoring business at home. She is a hardworking and modest woman who needs a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her business and provide tailoring services at home.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her business and provide tailoring services at home

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.ru:
Давлатмурод мудрый человек, который имеет достаточного жизненного опыта. Ему 60 лет. Он женат и имеет 5 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Давлатмурод
более 14 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как помидор, огурец и пшеница. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Он выращивает овощи на 2 га земли.  Он хочет развевать бизнес дальше и поэтому ему необходимо улучшить состояние земли. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Davlatmurod is a wise man with  plenty of life experience. He is 60 years old. He is married and has five children. His children are grown up. For 14 years, Davlatmurod has been selling farm produce, such as tomatoes, cucumbers and wheat. He sells his produce at the marketplace. His wife helps him in his business. He grows vegetables on two ha [about 5 acres] of land. He would like to develop his business further, which is why he needs to improve the condition of his soil. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 TJS in order to buy mineral fertilizers. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chicken cuts and fish for his business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 58 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Tessie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Tessie has been farming sugarcane for five years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Bella works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothing. Bella is borrowing PHP20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. Bella has been sustaining her business activities via her past 10 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39 years old, married with 6 children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a 19,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.
 
In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Women Of Faith Group

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Hellen from Harare. She is married with three children and two are attending school. She also takes care of her mother and mother-in-law. Hellen runs a clothing and grocery business which sells men's and ladies' clothes. The business has been in operation for 8 years. She says the main challenges being faced are limited quantities of goods required at the border post and high competition levels in the sector. Hellen has requested a loan of 750 USD to buy new clothes for the winter for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to send her kids to better schools and improve the family's quality of life. In the future, Hellen plans to have a big shop in town.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Fatos

texts.en:
Fatos, who lives in southeastern Albania with his family, is a father and a loving grandfather to his granddaughters, whom he adores. 

A loan of ALL 120,000 (Albanian lek) will help Fatos to replace some damaged parts of his harvester machine that recently broke down and that he cannot afford to repair with his own money.

Fatos has been serving the villagers with his agricultural harvester machine and has also been planting and selling vegetables to locals. “I have been practicing my services for the last fifteen years now and have been able to make a good income and also enjoy helping my fellow villagers,” Fatos said.

loans.use: to repair his agricultural harvester machine.

loans.name: Dúo Pacorral Group

texts.es:
DUO PACORRAL
Doña Flavia es originaria de la aldea Pacorral tecpan tiene 39 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta 1 hija menor de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
Desde hace años ella viene realizando estas actividades porque es el medio que la ha ayudado para salir adelante con su hija.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer a sus clientela variedad de tejidos y de esa forma obtendrá mejores ganancias para  dar a su hija una mejor educación  para un futuro mejor,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos
texts.en:
The "Pacorral" Due

Flavia is orginally from village of Pacorral Tecpan.  She is 39 years old and has a daughter who is under the age of 18.  Flavia makes a living weaving typical handicrafts and raising animals.

She has been doing this work for some years now as it has helped her to prosper with her daughter.

Flavia's dream is to expand her business further, offering her customers a greater variety of woven products.  In doing this she will earn a higher income so that she can offer her daughter a better upbringing and a better future.  Flavia is applying for this loan to buy materials to produce her typical, woven products.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce her typical, woven products that she will then sell.

loans.name: Razeem's Group

texts.en:
A member of a two-person group, Razeem is a 30-year-old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two children. 

Since 2004, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. This is the only source of income for their family. Due to the increase in the demand of the customers, Razeem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for the expansion of her husband's shop. 

With the loan, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables and fruits that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. He would also build one more room, to add some more space to his shop. Her husband is a very hard-working and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

NOTE: In the picture, Razeem is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables and fruits and to expand her husband's shop.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 28-year-old married man. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with his wife and parents. His parents have a retirement pension. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

George has a Donner fast food in the capital city. This is his only source of income. George requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit George will purchase a special apparatus for beer, which will be placed in his fast food and George will offer his clients an additional product. This will increase the income and the number of clients. With the increased income George will be able to expand the business in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a special beer apparatus.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya on the slopes of Mount Kenya. She has been farming for three years. Her main sources of income are eggs, tea leaves, maize and beans.

She wants to increase her poultry farming and has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. The proceeds from this loan will give her more income and thus improve her living standards.The challenges she faces are irrigation and poor climatic conditions.

In five years, she will have opened a milk bar. Mary says that Juhudi Kilimo offers quick services to the farmers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives in arural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle-class family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a plastic utensils shop which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household's needs. 

Currently, he needs to purchase plastic utensils to sell. However due to the lack of cash he finds it difficult. Therefore, Haseena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the things that are needed for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase plastic utensils to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 36-year-old, hard-working, and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a barber shop for three years. Due to the increase in the number of customers, her husband wants to expand his business. For that purpose, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

Her husband would purchase some new chairs for his shop. He would also buy some items, like a shaving machine, creams, a dryer, and blades. This would increase his earnings and net income. 

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and other supplies for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a 29-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three daughters. Since 2006, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. 

Nighat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables for a shop.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 42 años de edad , está casada y es madre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Olga consiste en la venta de comidas en un mercado de su ciudad. Ofrece a la venta carnes asadas combinado con porciones de arroz y papa. Complementa sus platillos con la venta de bebidas envasadas o refrescos naturales. Trabaja todos los días con ayuda de su esposo t lleva en este negocio más de 3 años.Le gusta mucho realizar su trabajo porque tiene tiempo para cumplir otras labores durante el día,  además tiene buenos ingresos económicos que le permiten sobrellevar los gastos de su hogar, le gustaría tener un local propio con todos los implementos que necesita para brindar una mejor atención.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles y está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con su negocio además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará los ingredientes que necesita para preparar sus comidas tales como arroz, carnes, papa y otros.
texts.en:
42-year-old Olga is married and the mother of three children with whom she lives in her own home.  Olga's business is selling meals in a market in her city.  She sells roasted meat with portions of rice and potatoes.  She complements her meal service by also selling pre-packaged drinks or natural soft drinks.  She works every day, with her husband's help, and has been in this business for more than 3 years.  She very much enjoys her work because it gives her time to carry out other tasks during the day.  In addition, she also makes good income which allows her to cover her household expenses.  Olga would like to have her own business premises with all the equipment she needs to provide a better service to her customers.

On this occasion, Olga is requesting a loan for 800 soles.  She is grateful for this financial support which she needs to make progress in her business and pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy the ingredients she needs for preparing her meals such as rice, meat, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 58 años, casada tiene dos  hijos, ella se dedica a tejido de variedad de prendas de vestir, ella tiene catálogos de muestras y realiza el tejido según pedido, tiene su taller en la zona de Mario Mercado, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para el tejido de prendas  ya que por esta fechas tiene muchos pedidos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus prendas, la Sra. Maria se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She makes a variety of knitted clothing. Maria has a catalog of samples that she uses for demonstration and produces the knitted items to order. Her workshop is in the District of Mario Mercado. This loan is her first cycle with Emprender. Sra. Maria will use the loan to buy wool in bulk for making knitted clothes since she currently has many orders. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to increase her operating capital.

Sra. Maria confronts challenges in her business, such as restocking her merchandise. She will utilize the benefits of this loan to continue buying in bulk the materials that she needs for making knitted clothes. Sra. Maria feels pleased and is appreciative of Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy wool for making knitted clothes.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Comfort, from Moriba town Bo, a southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between the ages of 2 years and 14 years. Her children are going to school. She started business because she wants to stop depending on her husband alone, instead, creating her own income.

Comfort runs a pharmacy business. She sells pads, malarial drugs, and tabs and injections. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business, six days per week and twelve hours per day. She says, at present, her business is doing well. Out of the profit, she is able to have her source of living.

Comfort has requested a loan in order to purchase more medical drugs, including pads, malarial drugs, and tabs and injections, to expand her enterprise. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and change her status of living. 

In the future, she plans to open a big clinic, so that she can help her community from illness. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs, including pads, malarial drugs, and tabs and injections, to expand her enterprise.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 56 years old and married, with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Celerina runs a rug-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional rugs to sell.

Celerina has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rugs to sell.

loans.name: Dina Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Dina  tiene 32 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Matienzo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Dina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Dina, 32, makes a living selling basic necessities in her neighborhood store in the Matienzo area.

This is her first loan sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy merchandise to stock her business with groceries, sweets, and refreshments.

She's requesting this loan because she has a lot of demand, which will increase her sales, and she needs to stock her merchandise.  The challenge Dina faces in her business is competition because there are several stores in the area.  She's going to use her profits to buy more merchandise to stock her store and keep growing every day.

Her desire for her business is to continue selling and to have a well-stocked store so she can make her business grow, improve her income, and, as a result, improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Zaib Un Nisa

texts.en:
Zaib un Nisa is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a tailor, which is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. He is in need of purchasing a machine, but due to the lack of income he finds it difficult. 

Zaib un Nisa is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to purchase a machine for her husband's tailoring shop.  She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya, a very productive area situated along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She is married and has three children, all attending school. She has been a farmer for 15 years. Her major source of income is growing tea.
She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase rabbits. This will bring in additional income and uplift her family's living standards. The challenge she experiences is pests and diseases. In the next five years, she plans to start a hotel business.
Jane says that Juhudi Kilimo is best for her.

loans.use: To purchase rabbits

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 35-year-old, hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and three children. Her husband has been running a gem stones business for 10 years. He has a shop in the main market of the city. Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the loan, her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gem stones. This would attract more customers and his sales would be increased. From the profits, Shaheen would pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children.

loans.use: To purchase gem stones

loans.name: Husan Bano

texts.en: Husan Bano is 49 years old and a married woman. She has three children, all of whom are studying in college. For the past three years, Husan Bano has been selling different types of ready-made clothes, in the Kalaiya market. She currently has a lot of loyal customers, who frequently visit her shop. She has requested the loan amount of Nepalese Rs (NPR) 100,000, which she will use to expand her stock of merchandise. This will enable her to offer a variety of clothes to the customer. Her future plan is to continue expanding her business and to give her children a good education

loans.use: to pay for additional clothes to increase the stock, so that she can meet ever-increasing demand

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Mr. Davaa is 57 years old and lives with his wife in a Ger (a Mongolian Traditional Yurt) in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Tsetsegbold is 49 years old and runs and small retail business in the local market. Davaa has been running his own business, a butcher shop, in a rented area since 2003. He has built a close relationship with his customers and has served the best products to them over the years. He is a well-experienced man. 

He is building a small house and is now requesting loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase insulation material and construction material to build an energy efficient house to stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and construction material to build an energy efficient house.

loans.name: Vasilika

texts.en:
Vasilika is requesting a loan for Arben, her husband, who is shown in this photograph with her. The loan that they request is an amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek. They will use it to buy iron metal sheets for his welding business. This will be their fifth loan from the same institution, with the previous ones being paid off.

For the past 10 years, he has been practicing welding skills in the surrounding villages and has been generating a good income. Comments from people in their village: “He is very artistic and the railings he makes are so beautiful." "He is a very good person to deal with.” 

Vasilika and Arben appreciate very much what lenders at Kiva do for people in need around the world.

loans.use: To buy iron metal sheets for her husband's welding business

loans.name: Rhina Patricia

texts.es: Rhina de 38 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde  reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende  las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; rhina es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de  ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene delante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Rhina  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Rhina is 38 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She has a tortilla shop that is well-known in the town where she lives. Rhina has many customers since she sells the best tortillas, which are served hot. She also provides very fast service and really affordable prices.

Rhina is an enterprising woman who has the desire to succeed and a winning attitude. For this reason, she has stayed in front of the competition. She believes that when you want something, you should be willing to take risks since life is full of them. Rhina wants to take a risk so that she can make her business grow. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy corn in bulk. Rhina hopes that this will provide financial security for her household and a fulfilling life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea, 50, is a married woman with eight children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dorotea has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Dorotea requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads and buttons for her business.

Dorotea has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Dorotea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads and buttons for her business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of  three children. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband owns a spare parts shop which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. Presently, he is in need of purchasing motorbike parts, such as chains, wheels, tires, headlights, race cables and brake cables the shop. However, due to insufficient income, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Salma has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needed things for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy motorbike parts, such as chains, wheels, tires, headlights, race cables and brake cables

loans.name: Ronny

texts.en:
What is your background?
My name is Ronny. I have two children, aged six and four years old. I am married and my wife runs a farm. When I competed high school in 2002, I did not have money to go to college and so I sold small things in the streets. Street-vending made me the person I am today because I came to learn a lot of things about life and about business. 

What will you use the Kiva loan for?
I will use the Kiva loan to add to my operational capital, so that I can be able to serve customers who come and send and receive money from my shop.

What do you love about your business?
I love every aspect of running my own business, especially the fact that it has made me more sustainable. I am now able to provide for my family. It is also nice that I run a business that provides a service to all kinds of people.

What are the challenges that you face in your business?
So far, my business lacks enough working capital. Monze, as a town, has grown and clients have increased with its growth. So, with a small operating capital, it is very hard.

How does your business benefit customers in your community?
My business provides the quickest, easiest, and safest way of moving money in my hometown.

What are your hopes and dreams for the future?
My greatest dreams are to grow into the largest money transfer agent in Monze and to provide services to the expectations of my clients, and Zoona,  which provides the platform.

How will the loan help you?
The Kiva loan will help to boost my operating capital, so that I do not run out of cash whenever my clients need it.

loans.use: to serve customers who want to send and receive money from his shop.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 50 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de frutas y verduras como por ejemplo plátanos, papayas, piñas, tomates, cebollas, zanahorias y otras cosas más.  Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como lechugas, cebollas, tomates, papa y otras.  

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mercedes, 50, lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who is moving ahead.  Her main economic activity is selling fruit and vegetables like bananas, papayas, pineapples, tomatoes, onions, carrots and others.  She’s been a member of the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and on this occasion needs the loan to buy vegetables like lettuce, onions, tomatoes, potatoes and others.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in the Province of Paucartambo in Cusco Department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Ricardo David

texts.es:
Ricardo de 65 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y un gran padre, así lo aseguran sus hijos. Labora diariamente en su tienda en donde comercializa productos de la canasta familiar. Gracias a su actividad ha podido sacar a sus nueve hijos adelante. En la actualidad desea aprender sobre la elaboración de panes con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos y aumentar su nivel de ventas, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios. 
Asegura que capacitarse es una gran oportunidad para mejorar no sólo su calidad de vida sino la de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 65 years old, an enterprising man, and a great father -- or so his children tell him. He works daily in his store, where he sells staple items. Thanks to this work, he has been able to take care of his nine children. Currently, he would like to learn about bread-making. His goal is to increase his portfolio of products and to increase his sales. He is requesting a loan because he does not have the resources himself.

He is sure that learning this skill will be a great opportunity to improve not only his own quality of life, but also that of his entire family.

loans.use: to take a bread-making course

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, gaseosas, galletas, dulces, verduras, frutas y otras cosas más.  Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz.  

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 28, lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who is moving ahead.  Her main economic activity is selling basic staples like rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, cookies, candy, vegetables, fruit and others.  She’s been a member of the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and on this occasion needs the loan to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in the Province of Paucartambo in Cusco Department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Perebeth

texts.en:
Perebeth is married and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. To make a living, she owns and manages a transportation service, providing motor transport services. She earns 12,000 PHP a month and has been in this business for four years. 

Perebeth is borrowing the amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to pay for the maintenance of her motorbike and to purchase accessories. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to improve her transportation services in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenace of her motorbike and for accessories.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. This area is known for its productivity and fertile land. She is married and has three children of whom one is still going to school. Her main sources of income are tea leaves, coffee, maize, potatoes and she also has a tailoring and hotel business.

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo that will enable her to put up a water tank to store water for her farming activities. A continuous supply of water in the farm will improve productivity and hence increase her income. This loan will help her to cater for her family's needs.The challenges she faces are pests and diseases.

In five years, she wants to have at least one acre for horticultural activities.Agnes says that Juhudi Kilimo is making her shine in her farming practices.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Alegres Group
