Le groupe Djapadji 2 fait partie de la coopérative Coopajo et est située à Dagadgi, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de trois personnes. Bernard a 66 ans et fait partie du groupe Djapadji 2. 
Il s’occupe de sept personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 33 ans qu’il travaille dans le cacao et il a 7 hectares de cacao certifiés Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais et des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il souhaite scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
This Djapadji 2 Group is part of the Coopajo cooperative. The group is from Dagadgi, a small village in the southwest of Côte d’Ivoire, located in the San Pedro region. The group has three members. 

Bernard is 66 years of age and is part of the Djapadji 2 group. He is responsible for seven people at home. For the past 33 years he has worked with cacao, and has seven hectares of cacao farmland which are Rainforest Alliance certified. This means that they adhere to the principles and regulations of sustainable agriculture. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cacao plantation. These items will allow him to increase his production, as well as to increase his income. With the additional money, he wants to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María de 33 años de edad, reside en el campo y se ha dedicado a la cría de pollos y cerdos, actividad que le genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia y la educación de sus dos hijos menores de edad.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de ganado lechero con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y la calidad de vida en su hogar.
Sueña con adquirir una vivienda y brindarle a sus hijos mejores oportunidades de vida
texts.en: María is 33 years old, lives on the farm, and has dedicated herself to raising chickens and pigs. This activity earns her the income necessary for the sustenance of her family and the education of her two young children. Currently, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of milk cows with the goal of improving her economic circumstances and the quality of her household's life. She dreams of buying a house and offering her young children opportunities for their lives.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un señor casado  de 29 años quien tiene 4 hijos  3 mujeres y 1 hombre,   quienes viven en Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura y lleva 15 años en esta labor. Eligio está actividad porque le gusta y es donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos, con lo que gana cubre los gastos del sustento familiar.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de semilla y fertilizante orgánico para cultivo de papa.
Sueña con construir su casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro, 29, is a married man father of four children: three girls and one boy.  They live in Sololá.  He works in agriculture and has been in this line of work for 15 years.  He chose this activity because he likes it and it’s where he earns most of his income.  He’s able to cover family expenses with what he earns.  

He’s asking for a 5,000 Quetzal loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to grow potatoes.  He dreams with building his house to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to grow potatoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una señora  soltera de 52 años quien tiene 3 hijos 2 mujeres y 1 hombre, quienes viven en Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la artesanía y a tejer desde hace 15 años, eligió esta labor ya que puede comercializar su producto en la pequeña tienda de artesanía que tiene. A través de lo que comercializa en donde vive, obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables para cubrir los gastos de la economía familiar.
También se dedica a una segunda actividad como agricultora, lo realiza porque desea mejorar sus ingresos y aportar al progreso de su familia.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 9,000.00  para compra de semilla de zanahoria y fertilizante orgánico para cultivo de zanahoria.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio y comprar un terreno, mediante las ganancias que obtiene a través del trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Margarita’s a single, 52-year-old lady who has three children: two girls and one boy.  They live in Sololá.  She’s worked as a craftswoman and weaver for 15 years.  She chose this work because she can sell her wares in the small crafts store she has.  By means of what she sells at home she earns income and adequate profits to cover family expenses.  

She also has a second occupation in agriculture.  She does this because she wants to improve her income and contribute to her family’s progress.

She’s asking for a 9,000 Quetzal loan to buy carrot seeds and organic fertilizer to grow carrots.  She dreams with expanding the business and buying a piece of land by means of the profits she earns through the work she does.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and organic fertilizer to grow carrots

loans.name: Yaneth Viviana

texts.es:
Yaneth de 23 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de panadería desde hace algunos años cuando decidió montar su propio negocio. Con el fin de mejorar las ventas y la calidad de sus productos, Yaneth se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en capacitarse en la elaboración de bizcochos y cubiertas. 
Lo que le permitirá aumentar sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Sueña con seguir creciendo dentro del mercado local y convertirse en la número uno del sector.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 23 years old and, since she decided to start her own business, has been earning a living making bread for some years.  In order to improve her sales and the quality of her products, Yaneth is applying for a loan to invest in training in preparing pastries and toppings.  This will allow her to increase the number of customers she has and generate a higher income to support the household.

Yaneth dreams of the business continuing to grow within the local market and of becoming the top businesswoman in town.

loans.use: to pay for training in preparing pastries and toppings.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 56 years old and widowed with one child. Edita works very hard to provide for them.

Edita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like bread, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, etc. in her general store.

Edita has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as bread, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, etc. 

Edita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like bread, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Aminata from Moriba town Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children, 5 years old and 22 years old. Her children are attending school. 

Aminata runs a home products business. Her various kinds of home products are food containers, bowls and buckets. She has been running this business for the past 17 years. She works at the business throughout the week, 10 hours per day.   She says that her business is doing well; her customer rate is increasing.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase food containers, bowls and buckets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase like food containers, bowls and buckets.

loans.name: Dúo Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO DULCE ESPERANZA
Doña Selsa es originaria de la aldea Pacorral del municipio de Tecpan  tiene 53 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
Desde hace años ella viene realizando esta actividad ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante con su familia.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de el y de toda su familia ella ha podido sacar adelante su familia.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos
texts.en:
Sweet Hope Duo

Selsa’s from the village of Pacorral in the municipality of Tecpan.  She’s 53-years-old and works hand weaving traditional textiles and raising animals.  She’s been doing this for years since it’s her means of earning a living to get ahead with her family.  Her husband works as a day laborer and thanks to his and her entire family’s support she’s managed to move her family forward.  Her dream is to expand her business more to earn higher profits to improve her quality of life.  She’s asking for the loan to buy raw materials to manufacture the traditional textiles.

loans.use: to buy weaving supplies.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and six children. Since 1999, her husband has been working as a scrap dealer, which is the only source of income for their family. They belong to a poor family and his income is inadequate to run the household. 

Rani has requested a loan from Kiva's partner Brac Pakistan. The loan amount will help her husband to purchase scrap iron, plastic and nylon for reselling at a profitable price. With the help of this loan, her husband will be able to grow his business and increase their income from it. 

Rani dreams of the higher education of her children. She hopes that the financial issues of her family will resolve soon and she can start putting aside savings for her children's education. She is grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase scrap iron, plastic and nylon for reselling.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La señora Vitalina de estado civil unida de hecho, cuenta con 59 años de edad, curso 1 año de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos y los 2 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a preparar refacciones para venderlos cerca de su casa y lugares cercanos, inició este negocio con pocas ventas y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para preparar mas refacciones y asi agrandar su capital de trabajo, en el futuro desea tener mas ventas y mejorar sus ganacias; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a vender refacciones y a tienda de consumo diario. En la fotografia aparecen 8 integrantes, pero solamente a 7 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Vitalina’s in a common law relationship; she’s 59-years-old and completed first grade.  She has two children and both of them are attending school.  She works making refreshments to sell them near her house and in nearby locations.  She started the business with just a few sales and to date has 10 years’ experience.

She decided to organize a group to be able to request a loan she’ll use to buy ingredients to prepare more refreshments and increase her working capital.  In future, she’d like to have more sales and improve her profits.  

The other group members sell refreshments and run basic staple stores.  Eight members appear in the photo but the loan was only granted to seven of them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Oudba Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Ouadba fait partie de la coopérative Coopasm et est située à Doba, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de six personnes. Noteguem a 65 ans. Il s’occupe de vingt personnes dans son foyer. Il a 3 hectares de cacao certifiés Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais et des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va construire une maison pour prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Oudba Group is part of the Coopasm cooperative. The group is from Doba, a small village in the southwest of Côte d’Ivoire, located in the San Pedro region. The group has six members. 

Noteguem is 65 years of age. He is responsible for 20 people at home. He has three hectares of cacao farmland which are Rainforest Alliance certified. This means that they adhere to the principles and regulations of sustainable agriculture. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cacao plantation. These items will allow him to increase his production, as well as to increase his income. With the additional money he obtains, he plans to build a house to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a buy and sell purchase order cards business in the Philippines.

Victoria has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

Victoria has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна молодая и жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 34 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих замечательных детей. Мавзуна со своей семьёй живёт  в отдалённом от города посёлке. Это немного трудно для её детей, так как они учатся в городской школе, которая находится достаточно далеко от посёлка. Но Мавзуна с мужем делают всё возможное, чтобы их дети ни в чём не нуждались и развивались также как и другие дети, и учились в хорошей школе. Для этого им приходится много работать, чтобы удовлетворять все нужды и потребности своей семьи. Поэтому они занимаются собственным делом. Сама Мавзуна закупает в городе продукты  питания и привозит в свой посёлок для продажи. Для этого у неё есть собственный маленький магазин, где она может продавать свою продукцию. Также дополнительный доход в дом приносит её муж. Он занимается деканством. Каждый день он работает на поле. У Мавзуны также есть младший брат. Он живёт с родителями, которые уже вышли на пенсию. Он хочет в следующем году женится, но сейчас ему нужно заработать деньги для этого мероприятия. Мавзуна решила отправить своего брата на заработки в Россию, так как там он сможет заработать больше денег, чем если он будет работать здесь. Поэтому Мавзуна хочет взять кредит в Арванд, чтобы купить билет брату для поездки на заработки в Россию. Она очень хочет помочь своему брату и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Mavzuna is a young and happy woman, who is 34 years old.  She is married and has three beautiful children.  Mavzuna and her family live in a village far away from a city.  This is a little bit difficult for her children because they attend a city school, located fairly far from the village.  But Mavzuna and her husband do everything possible to make sure that their children are not in need and develop just like other children, and attend a good school.  They have to work a lot for this in order to satisfy all needs and desires of their family.  This is why they are involved in their own business.  Mavzuna buys food products in the city and brings them to her village for sale.  She owns a small store, where she can sell the products.  Also, her husband brings in an additional income home.  He is involved in farming.  He works in the field every day.  Mavzuna also has a younger brother.  He lives with his parents, who are retired.  He wants to get married next year, but now needs to earn money for this event.  Mavzuna decided to send her brother to work in Russia because he would be able to earn more money there than if he worked here.  This is why Mavzuna wants to obtain a loan from Arvand and purchase a ticket for her brother's trip to Russia.  She wants to help her brother very much and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase a ticket for her brother to travel to Russia for work

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Isata from Kandeh town Bo, in the Southern area of Freetown. She is married with six children between the ages of 10 years and 23 years. Four of her children are attending school. 

Isata runs a local food stuff business where she sells native rice and palm oil. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business throughout the week.   Her other source of income comes from her small-scale garden. Her major hardship is transportation problems. 

Isata has requested a loan in order to purchase native rice, wood and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a local food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase native rice, wood and palm oil.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a widow. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her area.
 
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Buri

texts.ru: Бури 71 год. Он женат и у него пятеро детей.  Бури со своей семьей живет в Хатлонской области в районе Руми. Его сыновья работают за пределами страны. Бури имеет среднее образование. Он трудолюбивый и деятельный человек. Бури, несмотря на свой пожилой возраст, хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Он планирует заняться купле–продажей мелкорогатого скота. Бури намерен закупать каждый месяц по трех голов овец, откармливать их в течение месяца и продавать с наценкой на рынке своего района. С этой целью он берет кредит для закупа трех голов мелкорогатого скота и его корма. За счет дохода от деятельности Бури хочет провести обряд обрезания внука.
texts.en:
Buri is 71 years old. He's married and has 5 children. Buri and his family live in the Hatlonovskaya region of Tajikistan's J. Rumi District. Buri's sons work outside of the country. Buri has a high school level of education and is a hard working and active person. In spite of his old age, Buri wants to start a cattle business. He plans to buy 3 sheep every month, fatten them for the duration of the month and then sell them on the local market for a profit.

He's asking for a loan so that he start his business by buying those 3 sheep and the feed for them. He wants to use part of the profits to pay for a circumcision rites for his grandson.

loans.use: to purchase 3 heads of small cattle and cattle feed.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам 50 лет. Она вдова. Его любимый муж умер, и она осталась без кормильца с 4 детьми. Мукарам более 16 лет занимается купле продажей топлива. Ее дочь помогает ей введение бизнеса. Вначале ей было очень трудно. Она брала у брата немного денег и начала свой бизнес. Постепенно, год за годом она усовершенствовала свои знания. Теперь ее бизнес развивается. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки топлива. Этот займ поможет увеличить оборотный капитал и развивать бизнес. Для нее это 7 цикл кредитования и она имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mukaram is fifty years old. Her beloved husband died and Mukaram was left alone, trying to support 4 children. For the past 16 years, she's run a retail business focused on reselling fuel. She opened it with a loan from her brother. It was very difficult in the beginning, but year after year, she was able to improve her knowledge of how to run this business. Now, her business is steadily growing.

Mukaram is asking for a loan of 5,000 soms in order to purchase some fuel. This will allow her to increase her working capital and expand her business. This is her 7'th loan and Mukaram has a good credit history. She's hoping for your help.

loans.use: To buy fuel in order to improve her working capital

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
Jenely is 35 years old and has five children. Jenely is married and all five children are in school.

Jenely is in the agricultural business buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell.

Jenely has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jenely would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en:
Aleksi is 39 years old. He lives in a small village of Terjola District with his parents. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. Aleksi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides, they have a vineyard, with 500 grapevines. They sell the harvested products and cheese at local markets. Alongside the agricultural activities, Aleksi serves local people as a taxi driver with his car. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Aleksi requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Aleksi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Aleksi will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, he will be able to sow the seeds of vegetables and sell the harvested vegetables at a good price. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is from Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Cecille owns and operates a flower garden aside from her grocery store business. Cecille has been planting and harvesting flowers for three years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for a living. 

In 2009, Cecille joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more variety of flowers to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more flowers to raise

loans.name: Andrea María

texts.es:
Andrea de 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años. Desde joven a tenido que laborar debido a la precaria condición económica de su familia. Asegura que todo lo que ha conseguido no es más que el fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación. Labora diariamente en su negocio dedicado a la venta de licor y bebidas refrescantes. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y mesas para la prestación de un mejor servicio.
Su mayor deseo es crecer dentro del mercado local y en un futuro próximo abrir nuevas sedes para expandirse.
texts.en:
Andrea is 24 years old and a single mother with one child who is three years old. She has had to work since she was young because of her family’s precarious economic situation. She says that everything she has been able to achieve is the product of her hard work and determination. Each day she works in her business selling liquor and soft drinks.

Andrea is requesting this loan to stock her business with liquor and soft drinks and to buy tables so that she can offer better service to her customers. Her greatest wish is to grow her business within the local market, and in the near future expand her business by opening new locations.

loans.use: to stock her business with liquor and soft drinks and to buy tables.

loans.name: Mujeres Coloniales Group

texts.es:
La Señora Florinda Juana es casada, tiene 29 años de edad, nivel de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a comprar pollos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, inició este negocio ayudando a sus padres y de ahi nació la iniciativa de comprar pollos de engorde, y hasta la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de pollos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, en el futuro desea que su negocio este prosperado y tener mas ganancias; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a comercio y pecuario.
texts.en:
Florinda Juana’s married.  She’s 29-years-old and completed elementary school.  She has two children one of which is attending school.  

She works buying chicks to fatten up for subsequent sale.  She started this business helping her parents and that’s where the initiative to go into buying chicks to fatten up arose; to date she has six years’ experience.

She organized a group and asked for a loan that will be used to buy chicks to fatten up and then sell.  In future, she wants her business to be prosperous and to earn higher profits.  The other group members are in commerce and animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy chicks to fatten up.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar has always dreamed of becoming a professional. Edgar is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards his degree in business. He plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Edgar plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Edgar currently works 30 hours a week and earns $16 a day. With a degree in business he expects to earn $20 a day. 

Unfortunately, Edgar's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up Edgar's family finances have always been tight. With three older siblings attending college already, Edgar is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Loan.

This loan is administered by Banco Fie, Vittana's local partner.

loans.use: to pay for his education.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel, de 34 años de edad , es padre de un hijo de 11 años y vive en su casa propia junto a sus padres y hermanos.Angel se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi. Es consciente que cuando un pasajero accede a su vehículo, pone en sus manos también su vida y su seguridad para que así llegue sano y salvo  a su destino. Tiene 3 mototaxis que pone en alquiler y uno de ellos es conducido por él. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 2 años y en todo ese tiempo ganó mucha experiencia además aprendió que el cliente siempre busca seguridad, rapidez, buen trato y precio justo.Le esta yendo muy bien en lo que hace, tiene muchas personas que lo contratan a veces por horas completas para transportarlos y así tiene mejores ganancias, ahora se está preparando para poder incrementar su trabajo y comprar otro vehículo para alquilarlo y tener un ingreso adicional.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800 soles y agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando.El monto solicitado lo utilizará en el mantenimiento y la compra de piezas para su vehículo .
texts.en:
Angel, who is 34 years old, is a father of one eleven-year-old child. He lives in his own home with his parents and siblings. Angel works transporting passengers in his mototaxi. He is aware that when passengers board his vehicle, they put their lives and their safety in his hands in order to arrive safe and sound to their destination. He owns three mototaxis: he drives one and rents the other two. He has been working this job for two years and in all this time he has gained a lot of experience. He has learned that customers always want safety, speed, good service, and fair prices. Things are going very well for his business. He has a lot of regular customers who hire him for full hours sometimes for him to transport them, which earns him higher profit. 

He is now preparing to increase his work and purchase another vehicle to rent and earn additional income. This time he is requesting 1,800 soles, and he is grateful to all the people who help give him the opportunity to access the financing he requires to keep working. He will use the amount requested to maintain his vehicle and by parts for it.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle and maintain it.

loans.name: Neymat

texts.ru:
Неймат мужчина в возрасти 50 лет живет в Дж. Расуловском районе.   Женат имеет  четверых детей.  Неймат предприниматель, он плотник, занимается производством деревянных окно и дверей.   Жена Мухаббат работает в дехканском хозяйстве.  Двое их сыновей  находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках.  По возможности присылают родителям денежные средства. 
  Два года назад Неймат решил построить дом для своего старшего сына.  Он достроил дом, но на отделку дома  ему не хватило немного денежных средств.   Неймат решил подать заявку на кредит и обратился в организацию Арванд. Он уверен,что с помощью Арванд он сможет создать уют и комфорт в построенном доме.  Неймат на полученный кредит хочет купить строительные материалы( обои, клей, известь,краски).  Он заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Neymat is fifty years old. He lives with his family in the J. Rasulov District of Tajikistan. Neymat is a carpenter by trade and makes a living by making wooden doors and window frames. His wife works in a "dekhan" farming organization. Two of their sons are away working in Russia and try to help out their parents when they can. 

Two years ago, Neymat decided to build a house for his oldest son. He built the house, but didn't have enough money to finish furnishing it. He's asking for a loan in order to buy some building materials (wallpaper, glue, paints, lime). Neymat is confident that with this loan he'll be able to make the house comfortable and cozy.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Mercilyn

texts.en:
Mercilyn is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. She's from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Mercilyn operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to her local community to earn a living. Mercilyn has been in this business for seven years. She earns 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

In 2006, Mercilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 53,500 PHP, which will be used to renew the motor registration and make additional payment for the new sidecar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to renew the motor registration and make additional payment for the new sidecar.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anatolio

texts.en:
This is Anatolio, 47, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Cecilia, his business partner, and is a father. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anatolio is a fish vendor. He buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. He buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. His store is located in a temporary fish market. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Anatolio hopes to expand his business and dreams to give his children a good, quality education. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a variety of fish needed in his business.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Ren is a 39-year-old and she is a widowed mother. Rice farming and sesame planting are the main sources of the family’s income; she has been doing this work for 12 years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the second microloan for Ren with Kiva’s partner and she completely paid back the first loan. Ren successfully used the loan to better support her family. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Ren will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “Las Esmeraldas” y  la conforman  09 socios, la gran mayoría de ellos vecino de la zona, dicho grupo se caracteriza por ser personas responsables y solidarias. Gladys 41 años, es  casada con 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Hace más de 04 años que se dedica al tejido, la cual confecciona chompas, chalinas, colchas, entre otros accesorios  y lo realiza a pedidos. Dicha actividad le ha permitido generar ingresos para su hogar. Gladys es una mujer trabajadora que busca superarse cada día, es por ello que asiste a talleres de tejidos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de hilos y lanas ya que tiene varios tejidos por realizar. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente. El grupo “Las Esmeraldas” agradece el crédito brindado. Gladys es la segunda del lado derecho y viste bivirí color celeste y pantalón negro. Ysabel no puedo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the “Las Esmeraldas” (The Emeralds) communal bank.  It has nine members most of them neighbors from the zone.  Said group is noted for being responsible, mutually supportive people.  

Gladys, 41, is married with three children two of which are still dependent.  For more than four years she’s been knitting; she makes jackets, shawls, bedspreads among other accessories and she does it to order.  Said activity has made it possible for her to earn household income.  Gladys is a very hardworking woman who seeks to make herself better every day which is why she attends knitting workshops.  She will use her current loan to buy yarn and wool because she has much knitting to do.  Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals.  Gladys is second from the right and is wearing a blue tank top and black slacks.

Ysabel was unable to be present because of work.  The Las Esmeraldas group is grateful for the loan provided.

loans.use: to buy yarn and wool.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es: Sayda, de 34 años, es una mujer joven y soñadora y muy amable, esta casada con Fidel y tiene una pequeña hija de 3 años de edad , juntos viven en su casa propia.El trabajo de Sayda consiste en la venta de zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y prendas de vestir, trabaja vendiendo entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, empezó desde hace 2 años y le va muy bien. Sus ventas son al contado o al crédito y realiza la cobranza de manera semanal.Se siente muy a gusto con su actividad laboral ya que le genera buenos ingresos, pero ella necesita de alguna ayuda adicional para la próxima campaña.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000 y está muy emocionada por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado comprará zapatos , zapatillas y sandalias para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sayda, 34, is a young, kind woman with dreams.  She’s married to Fidel and she has a little three-year-old daughter; they all live together in their own house.  

Sayda’s work consists in selling shoes, sandals, slippers and articles of clothing.  She works selling among her friends, neighbors and family members.  She started two years ago and is doing very well.  

She sells for cash or on credit and collects payments weekly.  She feels very good in her work activity because it generates good income but she needs some additional help for the upcoming sales campaign.  

On this occasion she’ll request 3,000 soles and she’s very excited about the financial support she’ll get to continue with her work.  She will use the requested amount to buy shoes, sandals and slippers for her customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives in a rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only person earning in the family. He owns an embroidery shop which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. 

Currently, he needs to purchase embroidery related items such as variety of threads, stones etc. However due to the lack of cash he finds it difficult. Therefore, Ishrat has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the things needed for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery-related items such as variety of threads and stones.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a video-making shop, which is the only source of income for his family. He provides video recording services of various events including marriages, birthdays, etc.

His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. Presently, he is in need of a digital camera for still photograpy. However, due to his lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide a quality education to her children. With the profit she wants to save money for the construction of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera

loans.name: Rosane

texts.en: Rosane’s business is growing so steadily that she is coming back to us for another loan to increase her stock! This time she is taking out another loan to purchase more solar desk lamps to sell on a rent-to-own basis in her community.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a clean energy retail business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Fatmata from Moriba Town Bo, Southern area in Freetown. She is married with seven children between the ages of seven years and 25 years. Four of her children are attending school. Her husband is a driver but he is out of a job for the moment so his income is not enough to take care of the home.

Fatmata runs a cookery business; she sells cook rice, fried fish and cool drinks. She has been running this business for 20 years. She wakes up 4:30am to prepare her cookery business, she will not rest until the food is finished; one of her daughter usually help her to run the cookery business. Her business is the only source of income she has. Fatmata describes her major hardship that sometimes to prepare the dishes is very difficult.  

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking items including bag rice, coconut oil, soft drinks and pure water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her cookery structure and save money to buy a vehicle for her husband. In the future, she plans to have her own residence. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking items including bag rice, coconut oil, soft drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Theresa from Moriba town Bo. She is married with three children. She also takes care of her mother. 

Theresa runs a palm oil vending business; she sells palm oil, nut oil and coconut oil. She has been running this business for four years. She walks to her business five miles to reach her area of business operation. She does not have any source of income except for this business. She says despite the hardship of not having a vehicle, she is hardworking and has the desire to become successful business woman and educate her children.   

Theresa has requested a loan in order to purchase local foods including palm oil, nut oil and coconut oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and improve her living conditions. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase local foods including palm oil, nut oil and coconut oil.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives in a rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only person earning in the family. He owns a clothing shop which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. 

Currently he needs to purchase a variety of clothes to resell them at a profitable price. However due to the lack of cash he finds it difficult. Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the things needed for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to resell them at a profitable price.

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en: Musarat is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only income earner in the family. He owns a welding shop, which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. Presently, he needs to purchase iron rods, welding rods, and soldering rods for manufacturing iron doors and windows. However, due to the lack of income, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Musarat as a member of a two-person group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase the needed items for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide a quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods, welding rods, and soldering rods for manufacturing iron doors and windows.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mariatu from Moriba town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with one child. She started business because she wants to get income to support her needs.

Mariatu runs a clothes business, she sells wax cotton and tie-dye material. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business throughout the week, 10 hours per day moving within her environment to introduce her goods. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says her business is doing well, out of the profit it enables her to take care of her needs. 

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to purchase a variety of clothing material such as wax cotton and tie-dye material. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location so she can stop moving door to door. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a shop level. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase variety of clothing material such as wax cotton and tie-dye material.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only person earning in the family. He owns a spare parts shop which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. 

Currently, he needs to purchase spare parts for motor bikes such as chains, wheels, tires, head lights, race cables, brake cables etc for his shop. However due to the lack of cash he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the things that are needed in her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase motor bike spare parts, such as chains, wheels, tires, head lights, race cables and brake cables for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, patos y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más gallinas. 

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Victoriano’s 31-years-old and lives in the city of Pilcopata.   He’s a hardworking, enterprising man who is moving ahead.  His main economic activity is agriculture and selling small animals like guinea pigs, ducks and chickens.  He’s been a member of the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and on this occasion needs the loan to buy more chickens.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province in Cusco Department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres tiene 49 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, patos y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y patos. 

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Andrés is 49-years-old and lives in the city of Pilcopata.   He’s a hardworking, enterprising man who is moving ahead.  His main economic activity is agriculture and selling small animals like guinea pigs, ducks and chickens.  He’s been a member of the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and on this occasion needs the loan to buy more guinea pigs and ducks.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province in Cusco Department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor tiene 39 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y la venta de  frutas como por ejemplo naranjas, mandarinas, piñas y otras cosas más. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar a los trabajadores que sacaran las frutas de los arboles. 
 
(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Victor’s 39-years-old and lives in the city of Pilcopata.   He’s a hardworking, enterprising man who is moving ahead.  His main economic activity is agriculture and selling fruit like oranges, mandarins, pineapples and other things.  He’s been a member of the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and on this occasion needs the loan to pay the laborers that harvest the fruit from the trees.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province in Cusco Department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 24 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de frutas como por ejemplo piña. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más piñas.  
(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata. She is hardworking, resourceful, shows initiative and is getting ahead. She works selling fruit such as pineapples. For a number of years now she has belonged to the communal bank “Chacoq”. She is requesting a loan to buy more pineapples.

The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province, which is part of Cusco Department.

loans.use: to buy pineapples.

loans.name: Faby

texts.en: Faby started selling EarthSpark clean energy products a few months ago, integrating these products into his existing business. His business has since expanded and he is coming back to us for another loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Ángela De Jesús

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene cinco hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era una niña; fue su padre quien le enseño a ella ya sus otros hermanos a trabajar muy fuerte para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Hoy en día, además de trabajar en la agricultura junto a su compañero de vida, también elabora y vende pupusas en una escuela. Los insumos que necesita para sus actividades productivas y para el hogar las adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 25 kilómetros de su casa; por existir escasez en el transporte debe esperar por horas para que pase el autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 bolsas de semilla, 20 quintales de abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas. Con la inversión, comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez, ahorrándose tanto viaje y más con la dificultad del trasporte en el lugar en donde vive. Su propósito, es continuar trabajando y que sus hijos estudien para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Angela is 41 years old, she has a partner and five children. She has been working in agriculture since she was a child; it was her father who taught her and her brothers to work hard to bring money home. Today, in addition to working in agriculture with her life partner, she also makes and sells pupusas at a school. She gets household and production supplies in a city about 25 kilometers from her home; due to the transportation shortage, she has to wait for hours for a bus to come by.

The loan she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy 5 bags of seed, 20 quintals (1 quintal = 100 pounds) of manure, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides. With this investment, she can buy all the supplies at once, saving herself a lot of travel, especially with the difficulty of transportation where she lives. Her intention is to continue working, and for her children to study to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of seed, 20 quintals of manure, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Marie Lifise

texts.en: Lifise lives in Felix, a small village about few kilometers from Port-Salut in an area without access to electricity. She is married and has two children in school with his husband. She is a teacher and has recently decided to start selling EarthSpark clean energy products. With a Kiva loan, Lifise will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  Lifise would like to sell solar energy desk lamps with mobile phone charging capability. She wants to sell clean energy products because he likes business and wants to participate in the environmental protection of Haiti.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Selnys

texts.en: Selnys started out his business with EarthSpark clean energy products by selling solar light bulbs and solar desk lamps in his community. His business has since expanded and he has now added charcoal efficient stoves to his product line. He is taking out another loan to be able to add to his stock.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 54 years old and married with six children. He resides in Sebasi of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Roberto operates an agriculture business. He plants and harvests corn and vegetables to sell in the local community in order to earn a living. He has been in this business for many years. Each month, he earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. After harvesting his farm,He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he joined in 2008, in order to purchase seeds and seedlings. 

In the future, Roberto would like to save in order to create an emergency fund for the future and to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilian Tiene como profesión Peluquera y comerciante. Es dueña de una mercería donde ejerce su profesión y a la vez vende ropas calzados y artículos de mercería. 

Además de todo ello es dueña de salones comerciales los cuales alquiela. Ella cuenta que es madre de un joven muy trabajador y luchador, y que ambos se ayudan mutuamente.

La señora Lilian ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos y está solicitando el crédito para la refacción de los salones comerciales que alquila, ya que es muy importante tener bien sus inmuebles para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la a oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Lilian is a hairdresser and retailer.  She owns a general store where she practices her profession and sells clothing, footwear, and notions.  

In addition to all that she owns commercial salons that she rents.  She says she's the mother of a hardworking young man who's a striver, and they both support each other.  

Lilian has shown herself to be a very responsible and honest person in her commitments. She's requesting the loan for refurbishing commercial salons because it's important to have her property in good shape to give her customers good service.

She's grateful for the opportunity she's receiving because it'll be a big help to her and help her to keep moving forward.

loans.use: refurbishing rental space

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en: Tam is 52 and a mother of 3 kids. Two of her children are in school and one is helping in the family business. Tam grows rice on one and one half hectares of land. The current business has returned her about 8,800 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan, which has improved her business gradually. Now, she leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to plow her farming area and to replant her cash crop on time.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Marhila

texts.en:
Marhila is 31 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to be a perfect businesswoman. She is married and has three children. They live in a house that is located in a village. 

Marhila is one of the successful businesswomen of her village. For more than three years, she has been busy with animal sales. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills have helped her to develop her business and in this way improve her living conditions. She manages the business alone. 

She wants to develop her business further, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for developing her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 37 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Arlene works very hard to provide for her family.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as bread, soft drinks, sardines, and other groceries. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Leonides Sr.

texts.en: Leonides Sr. is a 55-year-old fisherman from Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of four children. Loenides Sr. has been engaged in his fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. Leonides Sr. is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and paint for the boat. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his fishing business as well as his income. In the future, Leonides Sr. dreams of making his business successful and stable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and paint for the boat

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Adama from Moriba Town around Bo in Southern Province, Sierra Leone. She has had no schooling and is married with a child who is five years old.

In 2007 Adama began selling firewood because she was married at a young age and had to help support the family. She works every day from morning to night. She says that her main challenge is a lack of money to build up her business.

Adama is applying for a 900,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy additional wood to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will help pull her family out of poverty and assist her in learning how to be a caterer. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional wood to sell.

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal is 29 years old and the father of two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. 

Khayal grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant and other vegetables and fruits. He says, even though this business is very hard, together with his wife he has been handling the business for five years without any difficulty. 

Khayal grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from selling produce is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as obtaining more land for cultivation. Khayal is looking forward to increased sales in the summer, because people purchase fruits a lot.

He needs a loan of 1,900 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history; this is his third loan.

loans.use: to purchase new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rayta

texts.en:
Ms Rayta, 50 years old, has been making shoes for the past 20 years. A mother of six children and eager to support her family, she is responsible for meeting the basic needs of her children including food and health. She is also accountable to improve their standard of living. Her children help her in her business.

During a year of her business Rayta had little capital due to many problems receiving payments on time and was unable to expand her business activities. At that point, reluctant to take an informal loan from relatives, she contacted Kashf Foundation upon the suggestion of her neighbor. By the support of Kashf Foundation, she is now fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her children’s basic necessities.

Now in her her fifth year with Kashf Foundation, Rayta is requesting a loan of Rs. 35000 to buy additional shoe-making materials including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles. The loan will enable her to meet the growing demand for her products in the market and allow her to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional shoe-making material including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a married woman who is living with her husband and three children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about 15 years she has been doing embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Razia dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house since she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is applying for a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has six children. She is running a business in front of her house by selling gasoline. Juliana is making a good income from selling gasoline and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. She lives in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Konna

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Konna from Torkpoi town Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 11 and 25 years old.

Konna runs a local soap business; she sells local soap at her house. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business throughout the week and eight hours per day. She also receives income from her elder son. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Konna has requested a loan in order to purchase palm oil and detergent for making soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and put a roof on her house to protect her residence from the rainy season. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a soap making factory. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and detergent for making soap.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is 36 years old and married. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a butcher shop, which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. 

Presently, Ghazala's husband is in need of purchasing chickens to sell. However, due to the lack of income, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Ghazala, as a member of two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase products for his shop. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide a quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell.

loans.name: Kazim

texts.en:
Kazim is 45 years old and married with three children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee.  

For past ten years, he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Kazim is a retired person with an income of 100 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and Kazim is doing it together with his wife.

He is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

He has taken loan from Aqroinvest before and has a good loan history. This is going to be his third loan. This time he requires 1,700 AZN in order to purchase 12 sheep s that he can sell more meat in the summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in summer, more people consume meat due to holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz is 32 years old and the father of two sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee. His wife stays at home. 

A few years ago,  Ramiz decided to open his own business, selling basic grocery items needed in his neighborhood. Today, he is a person who enjoys his neighbors' and his family's respect.

He has been in this business for eight years. He sells food products in his shop, such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages. His wife helps him in this business. His monthly profit is 300 AZN. As this is the main source of income, his profit is used for family needs. The profit he earns is not enough to reinvest in his business in order to meet customer demand, so he is suffering for this reason. 

Ramiz would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in the business. For this purpose, he applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will buy and diversify foodstuffs to sell at his store. This will be his third loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more products for resale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making jewelry and has been doing this for many years. The man shown in the photo is Razia’s husband. The business has great potential for growth, and Razia is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. They have three children, and two of them are school going. The couple wishes to send all of their children to school by increasing their earnings. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Razia requested a loan of 10,000 PKR to purchase materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase their net income and wishes to spend a part of their profits on providing quality education for their children.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is a married woman and a mother of seven. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and after fixing stones, as per customer requirement, she sells them to the people in her community. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloths in her community and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.  Currently, Nasreen is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy different cloths for the summer season

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 29 años de edad, esta acompañado  y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez; fue su padre quien le enseño. Los insumos que necesita para sus actividades productivas y para el hogar las adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 35 kilómetros de su casa; son dos horas y media en autobús, por que es bastante escaso el transporte. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 bolsas de semilla de maíz, 24 quintales de abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas. Con la inversión, comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez, ahorrándose tanto viaje y más con la dificultad del trasporte en el lugar en donde vive, los aplicara a tiempo y en las cantidades correctas para que le genere una buena cosecha. Su deseo es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, comprar un terreno, seguir trabajando en la agricultura y con mayor enfoque en las hortalizas y cultivo de frutas, aprovechando que en la zona en donde vive permite este tipo de cultivos.
texts.en:
Víctor, 29, has a spouse and two children.  He’s worked in agriculture since childhood; his father taught him.  The supplies he needs for his productive activities and for his home he gets in a city that’s 35 kilometers from his house; it takes two-and-a-half hours by bus because transport is quite scarce.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy four sacks of corn seeds, 24 quintals of manure, fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide.  With this investment he will buy all the supplies at the same time so he won’t have to make several trips that are so difficult to do because of the transportation situation where he lives.  He will be able to apply them in a timely fashion and in the right amounts so that his crop yields will be good.

He hopes his children will complete their schooling, to buy a piece of land and to continue working in agriculture focusing for the most part on vegetables and fruit taking advantage of the zone he lives in which is propitious  for these types of crops.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Annie

texts.es: Annie, de 40 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora, es madre de dos hijos de 18 y 9 años quienes son fruto de su matrimonio, ella tiene una casa propia en donde comparte todos los días el gusto de criar a sus hijos y trabajar mucho para brindarles lo mejor, además de ellos también vive ahí un joven que les ayuda en el trabajo que realizan a diario.El negocio que tiene Annie esta relacionado al sector salud, Tiene un consultorio médico en un local alquilado y ahí recibe diversos pacientes que llegan con dolencias leves para encontrar soluciones a sus malestares. Estudió enfermería y hoy pone en práctica a diario todo lo que aprendió desde suturas, curaciones, inyecciones y otros. Lleva en esta actividad 5 años y hasta el momento le va muy bien. Trabaja con ayuda de otra enfermera.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite aplicar todo lo que aprendió en sus estudios, además siente satisfacción cuando sus pacientes regresan a casa contentos por haber solucionado sus malestares.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de agujas, jeringas, alcohol, gasas, medicinas de mayor uso y guantes quirúrgicos para que pueda seguir realizando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Annie, 40, is a brave, hardworking woman.  She’s the mother of two children who are 18 and 9 years of age; they are the fruit of her marriage.  She owns her house where she daily enjoys the pleasure of raising her children and working hard to give them the best.  In addition to them, another young man who helps them with the work they do also lives there.

The business Annie has is related to the health sector.  She has a medical office in a rented space where she receives patients who come by with various minor complaints seeking remedies for their discomforts.  She studied nursing and every day she puts into practice what she learned from suturing, to first aid treatments, to applying injections, etc.  She’s been in this activity for five years and to date is doing very well.  She works with the help of another nurse.  She likes her business because it allows her to apply everything she learned in her studies and she also gets much satisfaction when her patients return home happy to have had their discomforts taken care of.

On this occasion she will ask for 3,800 soles and she’s grateful and happy to know that she’ll continue having financial support needed to advance in her business to rely on .  She will use the requested amount to buy needles, syringes, alcohol, gauze, surgical gloves and the medicine she uses most so that she can continue doing her work.

loans.use: to buy syringes, alcohol, gauze, etc.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 35 year-old married woman. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He is a tailor by profession which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. Presently, he needs to purchase a machine.  However, due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, Mariyam has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needful things for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide a quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Angel Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio tiene 35 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos viven en San Jose de Chimbo junto con la familia, esposa e hijos en casa arrendada.

Patricio es chofer en una cooperativa de transporte de buses. Solicita el crédito para la compra de una coputadora e impresora. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el computador para que los hijos realicen los trabajos del colegio y la impresora para que puedan imprimir y así evitar que bayan a centros de computo y ahorrar dinero.

El sueño es tener siempre trabajo y dar lo mejor a la familia, en los tiempos libres de gusta reunirse y conversar con la familia y amigos.
texts.en:
Patricio, 35, is married and has two children.  He lives in San José de Chimbo with his family, his wife and children, in a rented house.  

Patricio's a driver with a bus cooperative.  He's requesting the money to buy a computer and printer. 

With the help of this loan his children will be able to do their homework and print in order to avoid the cost of going to an internet cafe.  

His dream is to always have work to give his family what they need.  In his free time he likes to get together with his friends and family to talk.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is in her late forties.  She is married with six children and also has five additional dependents at home. She runs a retail business in Kandeh town Bo, in the Southern area of Sierra Leone. She started this business because her husband does not have a job and  she needed to get a source of income to support the home. 

She's been in this business for 16 years and sells palm oil and wood from her house.  She says that the main challenges are transporting her goods is very difficult and improper business location.

Theresa requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more palm oil and wood to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to be responsible for her family feeding and to have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to open a local food store enterprise. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and wood to resell.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Ms. Irshad is a married woman. She is manufacturing shoes with buckles that are used in the embellishment of shoes. She beautifully makes shoes in different colors, designs and sizes at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 50,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase leather material, plastic leather and soles with spools of threads in various colors to increase her production. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her ninth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Irshad wishes to utilize part of the revenues to provide a good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase leather material, plastic leather and soles with spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Gulam  Fatima

texts.en: Ms. Ghulam Fatima is a vigorous lady and a mother of three; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.
