loans.use: To purchase a stock of groceries to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 53-year-old married woman. She is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of cloth selling for almost 7 years. She purchases cloth from different areas and sells in the main market for profit.

Shehnaz is the responsible mother of three children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life - there were often days when her children slept without having any food. But now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family.

To cope with increasing demand during the summer season, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of cloth in different colors. She is a member of a two-person group. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

NOTE: In the picture, Shehnaz is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cloth to sell

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Anselma works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising livestock. Anselma is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine.

Anselma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Oscar Alfonso

texts.es: Don Oscar de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el trabaja de albañil desde hace varios con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don Oscar solicita un crédito para comprar materiales como ladrillos, cementos, arena, etc. para construir los baños sanitarios en su hogar ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizar esa inversión y poder tener los servicios necesarios en su hogar.
texts.en: Oscar is 37 years old, lives in his own house with his wife, and has worked as a bricklayer for the past few years. With the profits that he obtains from his work, he covers some expenses of his home. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials like bricks, cement, sand, etc to construct bathrooms in his home, since what he earns now is not enough to make this investment and be able to have the necessary services in his home.

loans.use: to buy materials like bricks, cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es: Doña vilma de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. Doña vilma quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Vilma is 49 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and family. She works selling clothing, and has worked in the business for several years. It has given her much experience which allows her to obtain better profits. The business is located at her home. She has earned many customers because people know that everything is good quality, at accessible prices. 

Vilma wants to make a new investment, but does not have sufficient capital to support her. For that reason, she is requesting a loan which would allow her to purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, and all that is necessary for her business. She assures us that she will be able to pay off the loan and at the same time she has hope that it will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 54 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo Iván de 30 años de edad, juntos habitan la casa que construyeron en un terreno heredado a su esposo.La actividad que realiza Lina es la costura. Trabaja en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir y lencerías para damas, caballeros y niños. Aprendió este oficio estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Se inició en este rubro hace 20 años, inicialmente tenía solo una máquina de coser que compró con sus ahorros. Su centro de labores se encuentra en un amplio espacio de su hogar. Actualmente tiene 2 máquinas que le permiten culminar una obra en corto tiempo. Su clientela esta conformada principalmente por sus familiares y sus vecinos que reconocen la calidad de su trabajo. Se siente a gusto y cómoda realizando este oficio, es por eso que tiene planes de ampliar el espacio de su taller para mayor comodidad y exhibir sus trabajos terminados.En esta  oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permitirá avanzar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará 1 máquina remalladora además de materiales de confección como telas, hilos, elásticos y otros.
texts.en: Lina is 54 years old, married, with three children. She lives with her husband and her son Ivan, who is 30 years old. They live together in a house that her husband inherited. Lina is a seamstress. She cuts and sews clothing and underclothes for women, men and children. She learned this skill from studying at an occupational school. She has been doing this work for twenty years. At first she had one sewing machine that she bought with her savings. She works in a sufficient space in her home. Now she has two sewing machines, which allow her to finish a project in less time. Her customers are mainly people she knows and her neighbors. They know the quality of her work. She likes her work and feels comfortable doing it. This is why she would like to increase the size of her workshop. This would make her more comfortable and she would also have room to show her finished products. She is requesting a loan of 3800 soles. She is thankful for the financial support that will help her increase her business. With the money that she is requesting she will buy a serger machine and more sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic and other things.

loans.use: to buy a serger machine, fabric, thread, elastic and other items.

loans.name: Estiben De Jesús

texts.es: Estiben de 43 años de edad, es un hombre amante al campo, desde su infancia. Aprendió sobre el cultivo de la tierra gracias a su padre, quien dedicó toda su vida a la agricultura. Hoy Estiben sigue los mismos pasos en una pequeña finca que adquirió gracias a años de trabajo. Tiene sembrados de café, y en conjunto con su esposa se dedica de tiempo completo a la ejecución de la actividad. En la actualidad requiere de un crédito para la compra de abono, fumigantes y mano de obra, con el fin de sacar una cosecha de calidad y aumentar los ingresos. Sueña con expandir su producción y llegar a convertirse en un gran exportador.
texts.en: Estiben is 43 years old. He is a man who has loved the land since his infancy. He learned about cultivating the land thanks to his father, who worked all his life in agriculture. Today Estiben follows the same path on a little farm that he acquired thanks to years of work. He has plantings of coffee, and together with his wife, he works full time in this activity. Now he needs a loan to buy compost and fumigants and pay for labor, with the goal of having a quality harvest and increasing his income. He dreams of expanding his production and becoming a great exporter.

loans.use: to buy compost and fumigants and pay for labor

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla, tiene 36 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos, habita en la ciudad de Managua, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella comenzó con su negocio hace 10 años en el mundo del comercio vendiendo ropa y cosméticos. Tiene una buena clientela fija que siempre la busca para hacerle pedidos. Ella también ofrece sus productos a salones de belleza y empresas. Su proyecto es lograr ser una comerciante mayorista. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar cosméticos, shampo, cremas, perfumes. Sobre todo  le será gran beneficio para aprovechar la temporada del día de las madres que las ventas son altas.
texts.en:
Karla is 36 years old, married, mother of 2 children, lives in the city of Managua, and works selling cosmetics. She started her business 10 years ago in the world of sales, selling clothing and cosmetics. 

She has a good customer base that always looks for her to make orders. She also offers her products to beauty salons and companies. Her project is to be a wholesale seller. She is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics, shampoo, creams, and perfumes. Above all, it will be a great benefit to her to take advantage of the season of Mother's Day when sales are high.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, shampoo, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Andrés De Jesús

texts.es:
Andrés de 30 años de edad,  es un campesino dedicado al sector agrícola. Narra que desde los once años aprendió de la actividad gracias a su padre. Desde hace ocho años inició con su propio negocio, dedicado a la producción de leche la cual distribuye entre su comunidad y la demás es vendida a una empresa de lácteos. Gracias al desarrollo de su labor hoy sus tres hijos menores de edad, gozan de una buena educación. 
Con el fin de aumentar su producción, Andrés se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una estacionaria y dos terneras. Mejorando así sus ingresos y transformando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés is 30 years old, and a farmer dedicated to the agricultural sector. He says that since he was 11 years old, he learned the activity thanks to his father. For the past 8 years, he started with his own business, dedicated to the production of milk, which he distributes in his community and sells the rest to a dairy company. 

Thanks to the development of his work, today his three young children enjoy a good education. With the goal of increasing his production, Andrés finds himself requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of a stable and two calfs. This will allow him to increase his income and the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stable and two calfs.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is a married man blessed with five children. He is already 50 years old. His main source of income is from rice farming. He has been doing this activity for 21 years. Last harvest season, Alexander was able to generate a net income of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which has been used for their daily expenditures and other needs. At his age, Alexander now has difficulty working in the field doing all the work; thus, he is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to pay for farm laborers who will do the land preparation. He's hoping that his loan request will be granted so that he can utilize it in his agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for farm laborers who will do the land preparation

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 54 years old and lives in the small village of Sagarejo District with her husband, two sons and two daughter-in-laws. Manana requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have a vineyard. They pick the grapes and Manana produces ‘Churchkhela,’ a Georgian delicacy prepared from grapes strung on a thread in the nut flour thickened grape juice, to sell. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Manana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Manana will open a bakery. After the bakery is opened, they will bake Georgian bread. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is 42 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of five children and is a responsible and hard-working housewife. Her husband owns a furniture shop in the market. This shop is the base of earning for his family. He works very hard to meet the household expenses but due to the insufficient income he is facing problems to meet the needs of his family. Rafia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase a variety of furniture to sell. By doing so he will increase his net income and savings for the future. Rafia is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her husband's business. She wants to purchase a computer for her children with the profit. She wishes to provide computer education to her children in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase new furniture

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 42 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of five children. She owns a small embroidery business in her house. Her embroidery cloths are liked by everyone. Presently her stock of embroidery material is almost depleted, therefore she wants to purchase a variety of embroidery materials including colorful threads, beads, stones, needles and clothes. For that purpose Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her business. With the profit, she wants to construct her own house. She hopes that she will earn sufficient profit so that she could easily pay back the loan amount as well as construct her house. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan because this will help her to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
A $1,000 (USD) loan is offered to Rosalina to improve her business, a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy additional stock such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee. She has been involved in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Rosalina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 37 years old and is a hardworking and independent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and four sons. Her husband is a security guard. His income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

For eight years, Rani has been running a beauty salon. She wants to purchase more cosmetic products, such as makeup kits, facial scrubs, and nail polish, and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Rani has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. When she makes a profit, in addition to repaying the loan, she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space is now congested. 

She hopes that her business grows. She is very thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 22-year-old, young and energetic woman of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband. He is a mobile technician and runs his own shop. She is living in a rented house and she wants to build her own house.

Sumaira is a very experienced and skilled woman. She has been selling bed sheets and cloth for five years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new variety of bed sheets and cloth from other cities at a lower price and then sell it for profit. This loan could fulfill her dreams and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 40-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her spouse, three sons, and two daughters. 

Since 2010, Khalida's husband has been running a small vegetable shop. He usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. Khalida is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her husband's shop. With the loan, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables. This will allow him to offer more variety to his clients and increase his sales and income. 

Khalida's husband is a very hardworking and honest man. He is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Don Pedro vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 18 y 20 años de edad,  el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, don Pedro solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizantes., abonos, herbicidas, etc. y también para mejorar el terreno donde siembra para seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna
texts.en: Pedro lives in his own home with his wife and their two children, ages 18 and 20. He has been farming for 3 years, primarily planting corn and beans. With the sales from his harvests he is able to cover their household expenses. Pedro asks for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc and also to improve the land where he plants so that he can continue giving his family the things that they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en: Agusta is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She runs a business selling firewood from her house. Agusta opened her kiosk in 2010 with $300 in working capital. She lives in a town near the main road so many people buy wood from her everyday. She makes a good income and wants to buy more stock with the loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Tamriko

texts.en:
Tamriko, 27 years old, lives in Kutaisi district with her son, who attends school. Tamriko requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without success, her requests repeatedly rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. Tamriko has a plot of land where she grows melons and watermelon, selling them to resellers and earning only a small monthly income that is rarely enough to cover monthly expenses.

Tamriko requested a loan from Credo to start a family business, a request approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With her loan, Tamriko will cultivate more land, plant more fruits and vegetables, pay workers and purchase seed. Later she will have a good harvest which will be sold to the resellers. Tamriko will thereby increase her profit and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cultivate more land and plant more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, who is single, works hard to support her family. For five years now, she has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and  earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Marilyn has  requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

NOTE: Marilyn belongs to the third sex gender community.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años vive en casa propia con su familia, siembra maíz y maicillo, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a su familia en los gastos de la casa,  el cliente solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc.  para seguir con su cosecha y seguir ayudando en su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The loan recipient has been a farmer for three years. He lives in his own home with his family, and plants corn and sorghum. With his earnings he gets from his sales he helps his family with household expenses. He asks for a loan to buy needed inputs like compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc so that he can continue with his harvest and keep helping at home without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Victor Emilio

texts.es:
Víctor de 62 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia. Se dedica a la elaboración de artículos para el aseo como escobas, traperas, cepillo entre otros. Actividad con la que se ha ganado la vida y le ha permitido sostener a su familia. 
Sus productos son comercializados en diferentes tiendas del sector y a particulares. Con el fin de cumplir con la producción solicitada por un cliente, Víctor se encuentra pidiendo un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima. 
Sueña con sacar adelante su pequeña negocio y penetrar nuevos mercados a fin de mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Victor is 62 years old and is a hard-working man who is dedicated to his family. He makes cleaning articles such as brooms, mops, and brushes. He has always made a living in this way and it has allowed him to provide for his family. He sells his products in various different stores and directly to customers. In order to meet a client's order, Victor is requesting a loan to invest in raw materials. He dreams of making his small business successful and hopes to penetrate new markets in order to improve his income as well as the quality of life in his household.

loans.use: to buy materials to make cleaning articles to sell.

loans.name: Martha Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Martha, 55 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada desde hace 12 años. Negocio que inicio hace 12 años cuando sus primeros productos fueron los cosméticos por catálogo que vendía de puerta en puerta los premios que obtenía por ventas ella los guardaba para después venderlos, después compro una vitrina y la surtió de productos para el hogar asi como el servicio de fotocopias así fue recaudando capital para comprar mercadería variada. Hoy en día vende ropa, cosméticos, impresiones a color, fotocopias y artículos escolares. De esta manera se gana la vida a diario.
Ella está necesitando el crédito para comprar ropa interior de mujer, perfumes, cremas, cuadernos, lapiceros, libretas, borradores, lápices de colores, cartulinas. Uno de sus proyectos es lograr poner un Cyber café estudiantil.
texts.en:
Martha, 55, is married and a mother of three grown children. She has been a merchant, selling a variety of goods, for 12 years. When she started her business her first products were cosmetics from a catalog that she sold door to door. She saved the prizes that she won in order to later sell them. She then bought a display case and stocked it with products for the home, and also added photocopying servies. She was able to recoup her capital this way in order to diversify her merchandise. Now she sells clothing, cosmetics, color printing, photocopies and school supplies. This is how she earns her living.

She needs a loan to buy women's underwear, perfumes, lotions, notebooks, pens, folders, erasers, colored pencils and poster board. One of her projects is to be able to add an internet cafe for students.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear, perfumes, lotions, notebooks, pens, folders,erasers, colored pencils and poster board.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP12000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Felina has been in this business for one year. Felina earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Felina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

NOTE: Her primary business is selling fish. In the picture she has a small and big boxes of fish and a weighing scale for her business. They keep each box closed to stay fresh the fish. Beans are bought for their consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jurita

texts.en:
Jurita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Jurita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Jurita has been in this business for 35 years.

In the future, Jurita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This time, for her 16th loan, Marites is borrowing PHP 30,000 to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery and feed for her pigs. 

The general store business that was previously funded through NWTF and its Kiva partner continue to provide for Marites and her family the opportunity to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Noemia

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Noemia, to improve her business. She has a fish-selling business where many people come to buy every day. With the loan, she will buy some equipment for fishing. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Noemia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Senorinha

texts.en: Senorinha is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She runs a fish-selling business in front of her fishing boats. She will use the loan to buy items to keep in her fishing boats, such as equipment for fishing. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy equipment for fishing

loans.name: Sidonia

texts.en: Sidonia is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as second hand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags.

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is a 55-year-old man. He’s married and living in Lebanon with his wife and four children; two are working, while the others are still studying. Despite his tough work, Afif is obliged to work continually as he is responsible for covering his family's expenses. He has been working in the construction field since 1993. He’s specialized in floor coverings and has gained a fair number of clients asking for his services. Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation; that’s the reason why he’s asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing new tools, as he plans to keep on offering the best quality of work ever. In the near future, Afif plans to take added loans to open his own pavers shop. This is how he works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new tools.

loans.name: Syver

texts.en:
Syver is a 28-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. Syver started selling lights in November 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, Marie Providence, and their two children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su esposa y su hijo el tiene un negocio de venta de biblias, libros y artículos cristianos cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para poder comprar mas artículos para surtir su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The borrower lives with his wife and son and has a business selling Bibles, Christian books and articles near his place of residence.  With the money he earns from sales he strives to cover the household expenses.  The borrower is requesting a loan to buy more items to stock his business and improve his profits to give his family everything they need without limitations.

loans.use: To buy more Bibles and Christian books, CD's, etc.

loans.name: Elsa Cristina

texts.es: Doña elsa de 41 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 18, 14, 13 y 9 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, doña Elsa posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende  las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles;  doña Elsa es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Elsa  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: Elsa, 41, lives with her husband and four children, ages 18, 14, 13 and 9 who are in school.  Elsa makes tortillas and is very well known in her town.  She has many customers because she sells the best hot tortillas with the fastest service at really low prices.  Elsa is an entrepreneur with much determination to get ahead.  She has a winner's attitude and is always ahead of the competition.  She wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy corn wholesale.  She is hoping this will allow her to provide her home with economic stability and a full life for her family.

loans.use: To buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don jose de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 hijos el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 25 años, cuando su cosecha esta lista la almacena en sacos asi como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos en las agencias de compra-venta con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar don José solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, semillas, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y poder le dar a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José, 55, lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He has been cultivating corn and beans for 25 years and stores his harvested crops in sacks as shown in the photograph.  He then sells his crops to dealers and uses the profits from sales to take care of household expenses.

José is requesting a loan to buy the supplies he needs such as fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, etc. to continue with his crop farming so he can give his family what they need without limitation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en: Cerila, who is 46 years old, is a married entrepreneur in Poblacion 4, Clarin, with five children. Aside from her transport services that was still running, she also owned and managed a grocery store earning 6,000 PHP monthly for five years for a living.To improve her business, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 from GDMPC micro-credit, which she just joined in 2011, to purchase canned goods, bottled products and noodles. In the future, she is very much hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bottled products and noodles

loans.name: Rayziel Jay

texts.en:
Rayziel Jay is married with one child. Rayziel Jay is 25 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rayziel Jay sells operates her own general store to earn a living and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 6000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 3000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rayziel Jay has been a new member of PMPC. In the future, Rayziel Jay hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es: Sandra de 51 años de edad es comerciante de futas y verduras, además de cárnicos. Ella desde el año 2000, inició su negocio con la ayuda de su hermano quien la impulsó para que trabajara independientemente y así mejorar su situación económica.  Diariamente desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la misma jornada, se dedica a la venta de guayaba, mango, piña, papa, zanahoria, además de cerdo, pollo y carne de res, lo cual ofrece en un local propio sin intermediarios. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, y compra en las plazas de Barranquilla y la ciudad de Montería. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su sector tiendas y transeúntes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará frutas y verduras en un mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos y hacer de su credikiva su mejor inversión, pues disminuirá el costo de la comercialización, permitiéndole ganar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Sandra, 51, is a fruit and vegetable merchant who also sells meat.  She started her business in 2000 with the help of her brother who encouraged her to work independently so she could improve her economic situation.  Every day she works from 4:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. selling guayaba, mango, pineapple and carrots, as well as pork, chicken and beef.  She sells from a stall directly to customers on both a cash and credit basis.  She goes to Barranquilla and the city of Montería to buy her goods.  Her main customers are neighbors who live near the stores and passersby.

She is requesting a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy large volumes of fruit and vegetables.  By doing this she will have greater discounts and cut selling costs so she can earn a little more profit and make the loan her best investment.

loans.use: To buy large volumes of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 59 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and blessed with six children. Her husband is a farmer. She established her own small business to help support her husband in generating income for the family. Genara works in the agricultural business, raising pigs to sell commercially. She has been active in this business for 27 years and has generated a good return to date. She earns about PHP 22,300.

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She hopes that in the near future, a portion of the income generated will be reinvested into the business for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru: Эргашу 50 год. Он женат и у него одна дочь. Эргаш со своей семьей живет в северной части Таджикистана в районе Сптитамен. Он добрый и отзывчивый мужчина. Жена Эргаша преподавательница. Она работает в школе. Сам Эргаш занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Более того, он 17 лет занимался животноводством. Теперь хочет заново начать этот вид деятельности и заняться куплей-продажей крупнорогатого скота. У него остался коровник от предыдущего бизнеса, где он содержал скот. Эргаш запрашивает кредит для закупа трех голов крупнорогатого скота и его корма. Он планирует откармливать скот в течение 60 дней и затем продавать на скотном рынке. Ему будут помогать жена и дочь.
texts.en: Ergash is 50 years old. He is married and has one daughter. Ergash lives with his family in the northern part of Tajikistan in the region of Spitamen. He is a kind and outgoing man. His wife is a teacher. She works in a school. Ergash does field crop cultivation. Besides that he has been doing animal husbandry for over seventeen years. Now he wants to start doing this business again and begin buying and reselling large horned cattle. He has one cowshed from his previous business where he kept the cattle. Ergash is asking for a loan to buy three heads of large horned cattle and fodder for them. He plans to feed the cattle for sixty days and then sell it on the local market. His wife and daughter will be helping him.

loans.use: to buy three heads of large horned cattle and fodder for them.

loans.name: Juventina

texts.es:
Doña Juventina es una señora de 64 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, vive en Morazán, Yoro, junto a su hijo, su nieto y su nuera.
Hace varios años que doña Juventina con sus propios esfuerzos estableció su negocio de venta de ropa nueva como camisetas, pantalones, ropa interior, cosméticos y sandalias. Consiguió un  local o puesto de venta en el mercado de la comunidad donde vende la mercadería. Atiende  todo el día a sus clientes. Con las ganancias obtenidas más los préstamos ha surtido el negocio. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para  surtir de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos su inventario. Su plan es mantener surtido el negocio para satisfacer la demanda y obtener más ganancias para tener un  mejor nivel de vida y ayudar a sus hijos cuando necesiten.
texts.en:
Juventina, 64, is a widow and lives in Morazán, Yoro, with her son, grandson and daughter-in-law.  Several years ago, through her own efforts, Juventina started her  business selling new clothing such as t-shirts, pants, underwear, cosmetics and sandals.  She opened a stand in  the municipal market where she sells her goods and tends to customers all day.  She has been able to stock her business through the profits she has earned and the loans she has requested.

She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 HNL to buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics for her business.  Her plan is to carry enough stock to satisfy demand and earn more profit to lead a better lifestyle and help her children when necessary.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics to stock her store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a friendly and kind man. He’s from Lebanon and is 56 years old. He’s married to Nahida. They live together with two school-aged children. Since their marriage, Mohammad started to manage the family expenses and still does. And since he noticed that his income does not satisfy their needs, he decided to launch his clothing business with money he already had. He sells a wide variety of women's clothes and shoes from which he earns a fair amount of money daily. To better develop his work, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. He will be using the loan to pay his children’s study fees. One of his greatest dreams is to see them achieve higher educational degrees. Mohammad wishes to open other branches soon and earn superior income

loans.use: to pay his children’s study fees

loans.name: Ladielyn

texts.en: Ladielyn of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur is single. She owns and manages a retail business selling school and office supplies in the community. In order to improve the business, she borrowed 20,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit (she became a member recently) to purchase additional notebooks, pens, crayons and papers for sale. She plans to use her generated revenue as additional capital to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional notebooks, pens, crayons and papers to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is taking a loan of $1.000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second hand clothes, second hand shoes and second hand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) who offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is a 57-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Augustin started selling lights in November 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Speciose, and their four children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. They are both working.  He strives to work really hard in order to satisfy his family's needs and take some responsibilities off his father who is considered their main source of income.  And after many years of experience as a carpenter, Ahmad decided to work on his own. He opened his own carpentry business in 2008. He’s a reputable person who has gained a fair number of loyal customers so far. Today, he is in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work. He also wants to buy new tools and materials. He notes that this will improve his business and therefore, boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects and better develop his work.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his work

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is taking a loan of $1.000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second hand clothes, second hand shoes and second hand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Olimbi

texts.en:
Olimbi is 37 and has three children who are 13, 11 and 9 years old. Corn and wheat are what her focus has been on during the past 20 years.  She has been selling the corn to the local primitive mills and the wheat to bakeries.
 
Olimbi plants other veggies as well but in small quantities. “It is lots of work and my husband helps me, otherwise, I would not be able to do it all on my own. It is physical work…, “she sighed. “Sometimes in the beginning of spring, when our plants are still very small, rain goes on for long time and literally, it damages the crops. Whatever we had invested in goes in vain,” Olimbi said.

Olimbi will use this loan to buy pesticides for the crops

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her corn and wheat crops

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.ru: Хайрулло 38 лет и проживает он в Спитаменском районе. У него есть жена и дочь. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школе. Сам Хайрулло занимается торговлей. Сейчас Хайрулло хотел бы начать животноводческую деятельность. При дворе его дома имеется сарай для содержания скота. Хайрулло планирует закупать крупнорогатый скот, откармливать в течение 60 дней и затем продавать на скотном рынке. С этим намерением Хайрулло обратился за кредитом для закупа трех голов крупнорогатого скота. Он ждет и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Khairullo is 38 years old. He lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and has a daughter and a wife who works as a secondary school teacher. Khairullo works in retail. Presently, he would like to start raising livestock, for which he already has a shed in his yard. Khairullo plans to purchase cattle, feed it for 60 days, and then resell it at the livestock market. To this end, he has applied for a loan to buy three cows. Khairullo is awaiting and counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy three cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод женатый молодой человек. Ему 28 лет. Он живет у родителей в районе Шахритус. Дилшод по природе энергичный и предприимчивый человек. Он собиратеся начать торговый бизнес и заняться торговлей одежды. У него имеются сбережения, накопленные за счет купли-продажи скота. Дилшод уже приобрел торговую точку на раынке района. Теперь чтобы закупить товар и начать бизнес он обратился за кредитом. Дилшод планирует закупать товар оптом в месяц дважды и продавать по розничной цене в своей торговой точке.
texts.en: Dilshod is a married young man. He is 28 years old and lives with his parents in the Shahrituz region. Dilshod is by nature an energetic and enterprising person. He is planning to start his own retail business and sell clothing. Dilshod has some savings, which he accumulated while buying and selling livestock. He has already purchased a retail spot at the regional market and has now applied for a loan to stock up on merchandise and start his business. Dilshod plans to buy his merchandise in bulk twice per month and sell it at retail prices at his market stall.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a 52-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Priscilla been raising pigs/hogs for six years and she earns an income of 6,500 PHP per month. Priscilla became a member of GDMPC in 2011. Recently, she requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed and piglets to raise. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a drip irrigation system

loans.name: Willians Alexander

texts.es: Willians de 31 años de edad, el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocido por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, el quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Willians is 31 years old and has a store where he sells basic staple goods such as beans, milk, eggs and bread.  He has had the business for many years and this has given him experience in sales, thus allowing him to optimise his earnings.  The shop is run out of his home and is known by people in the neighbourhood.  Willians has a good customer base and the shop is well stocked.  He would like to increase business and invest more but needs capital to do this.  So, Willians is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy necessary items for his shop.  He assures us that he will pay off his debt and is confident that this loan will result in him having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, rice and more.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie works hard to support her family. Benjie is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines.

Benjie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

Benjie has been in this business for four years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Benjie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in her house selling rice. She is making a good income from selling rice and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her business in 2010 with her working capital of $150.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima is 38 years old. She is a hardworking woman who works at the hospital as a cleaning woman. She lives with her husband and four children in her house, which is in bad condition. Her house is old since it was built many years ago and it needs some repairs. In winter and in summer, it is very uncomfortable. She must repair all rooms of her house. She wants to provide a good living condition for her children. She is asking for a loan of 1500 somoni to buy building materials for repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Hace tres años inicio su propio negocio de venta de accesorios para celulares como forros, focos de mano, lentes, fajas, relojes, controles, carteras, etc.  Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante en la comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 12,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar achinería como lentes, focos, relojes de mano, fajas, carteras y otros. Su objetivo es incrementar las ventas y las ganancias para apoyar a su esposa y a su hija.
texts.en: Roberto is 32 years old, married and has one daughter.  He lives in the town of Morazan in Yoro.  Three years ago he started his own business selling mobile phone accessories, such as covers, hand torches, straps, watches, wallets and more.  Roberto works as a street vendor in his community.  Now on his second loan cycle, he is applying for a loan of 12,000 Lempira to buy low-cost consumer goods such as mobile phone covers, hand torches, straps, watches, wallets and more.  Roberto's aim is to increase sales and his income so that he can support his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to buy low-cost consumer goods such as mobile phone covers, hand torches, straps, watches, wallets and more.

loans.name: Nancy Melania

texts.es: Doña Nancy vive con su hijo de 13 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, ella tiene un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su hijo no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. La cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Nancy lives with her 13-year-old son, who is currently in school.  She has had a food stall near to home for some years and, with the profit she makes, she is able to cover household costs.  Nancy is a feisty woman who always gives her best so that her son never needs for anything.  Nancy is happy to have regular customers as her stall is in an area that has many passers-by.  Nancy would like to expand the stall by buying tables, chairs and basic supplies such as rice, chicken, meat, fruit, vegetables and more so that she can vary her menu more and earn a little more money.  However, she does not have enough money to invest herself so has applied to "Apoyo Integral" for a loan.  This will allow her to buy the items she needs and improve her income so that she can have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Doris Cecilia

texts.es: Doris de 31 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo desde hace 7 años vive con sus esposo y sus dos hijos comercializa sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Doris esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. pues esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi seguir llevando el pan diario a su casa.
texts.en: Doris is 31 years old and has been making a living growing corn and sorghum for seven years.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She sells her products in the local markets and, with the profits, is able to cover household costs.  Doris is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds fertilisers, manure, herbicides and more.  This is Doris' only job and she wants to continue to bring in an income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, herbicides and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up with more products such as drinks, soaps, detergents and other hygiene products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a drip irrigation system

loans.name: Marco Patricio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre de 25 años, nació en una zona selvática de la Amazonía ecuatoriana, en donde las oportunidades de estudiar eran escasas, por lo que apenas terminó la escuela primaria, adquiriendo los conocimientos básicos que lo ayudarían a lo largo de su vida de comerciante. Actualmente vive en Pastaza, un cantón ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta pequeña ciudad. En cada negocio se encuentra personas que no se han dado por vencidas frente a la falta de empleo sino que han emprendido con sus ideas de negocio para llevar una vida digna y hacer realidad sus sueños.
Marco es un hombre emprendedor siempre se ha desempeñado muy bien en el campo comercial, hace 5 años decidió invertir en la compra de un juego inflable a motor que entretiene a los niños y lo alquila por tiempos determinados  en las plazas y parques donde se ubica con la esperanza de conseguir el sustento diario. Invierte 10 horas cada día en la preparación, limpieza, mantenimiento y recorrido de parques infantiles en donde encuentra demanda del juego. Esta actividad se la enseñó un cuñado quien lo guió para la compra y administración del negocio. 
Marco ha estudiado la posibilidad de ofrecer otros productos mientras transcurren los periodos en los cuales los niños están jugando, entre estos productos ha visto la factibilidad de vender dulces, manzanas, caramelos, chicles, chocolates, etc., con lo cual sus ingresos aumentarán y de este modo él podrá mejorar su calidad. Para poder hacer realidad este paso de emprendimiento, Marco solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá exclusivamente en su negocio, mantenimiento y ampliación, por lo cual motiva a todas aquellas personas alrededor del mundo que quieran ser parte de este sueño a aportar con su emprendimiento y agradece a Fundación Alternativa quienes en busca de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus clientes, han abierto las puertas a la microempresa para desarrollarse y crecer.
texts.en:
Marco is 25 years old and was born in the Amazon rain forest in Ecuador.  Here, there are very few opportunities to study and Marco barely finished primary school, though there he did learn the basic skills that help him in his life as a businessman.  Marco currently lives in Pastaza, one of the cantons of the Pastaza province.  This is part of the Amazon Region in the Republic of Ecuador.  The capital of the canton is the city of Puyo, which is in the middle of the Amazon rain forest, in the west of the Pastaza province and at 924 metres above sea level.  The area is not hugely populated but there are a number of sites that are enjoyed by both domestic and international tourists, particularly in ecological and extreme sports tourism.  This is a city whose economy is growing every day in various business sectors, including cattle raising, agriculture and tourism.  Financial and commercial businesses have set up branch offices here in order to take advantage of the lively economy that the city has.  In every business, you can find people who do not give up even in face of a lack of jobs.  Instead of giving up, people create their own businesses in order to have a decent life and make their dreams a reality.
Marco is enterprising and has always worked well in business.  Five years ago he decided to invest in a children’s bouncy castle and he rents it out for specific time periods in the main squares and parks.  He sets-up there hoping to earn a living.  Marco spends ten hours each day preparing, cleaning, maintaining and travelling to and from children’s parks where there is demand for the bouncy castle.  Marco was taught how to set up and run this business by one of his brothers-in-law.
Marco has looked at the possibility of offering other products to sell while children are playing.  Among these products he has found he could sell sweets, apples, chewing gum, chocolates and such like.  By doing this his income would increase and he would be able to improve his quality of life.  In order to turn this idea into a reality, Marco is applying for a loan to invest exclusively in his business – to look after and expand it.  So, he encourages all those around the world who would like to be a part of his dream to participate and he thanks “Fundación Alternativa” who are working to improve their borrowers quality of life.  They have opened doors for microfinance projects to develop and grow.

loans.use: to invest in selling sweets at his stall.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru: Гулнару 44 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет одну дочь. Гулнар трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она является единственной кормилицей в семье. Она старается зарабатывать больше денег и улучшить условию проживания для своей единственной дочери. Она недавно прошла курс «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат о том, что она может организовать свой бизнес и составить свой бизнес план. Гулнар хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды, а также игрушек. Она очень любит маленьких детей и желает им добра и счастливой жизни. Гулнар запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки товара для организации нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время. Этот займ поможет женщине с трудной судьбой и ее дочери, которая растёт без отца, улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Gulnar is 44 years old. She is divorced and raising a daughter. Gulnar is a hardworking and kind woman. She is the sole provider for her family and tries to earn more money in order to improve the living conditions for her only daughter. Recently, Gulnar took the course "To Get Ahead", organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and received a certificate to say that she is ready to prepare a business plan and start her business.

Gulnar would like to start her own business selling children's clothing and toys. She loves small children and wants to show them her kindness and good wishes. Gulnar is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to stock up on merchandise in order to start her enterprise. She is counting on your kindness and promises to repay the loan on time. This loan will help a woman with a difficult life and her daughter, who is growing up without a father, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes and toys for her new business

loans.name: Yanira Morena

texts.es: Doña Yanira vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus cinco hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 10 años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; doña Yanira  es una mujer entregada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere realizar una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. ella tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Yanira lives with her husband and their five children. She works in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  She has worked in agriculture for 10 years and has gained valuable experience that helps her make a better living.  The land where she plants her crops is located in an agricultural area and it is very close to her home.  She sells her products in the surrounding region and she has many customers that prefer buying from her because everything she sells is of the highest quality at affordable prices and comes with great customer service.  

Yanira is very dedicated to her work and strives to get ahead.  She is seeking a new loan so that she can increase production.  She will buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, tools, etc.  She has great references and is confident that she will pay back the debt.  At the same time, she hopes that she will be able to improve the economic security of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, soil, bags, etc.

loans.name: Erasmo Antonio

texts.es: Don Erasmo de 44 años de edad, desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y sorgo, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 19,  17, 10 y 6 años de edad.  Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación decidió solicitar un  crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener  a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia
texts.en: Erasmo is 44 years old and for many years has made a living working the land.  He grows corn and sorghum with a lot of dedication and this work allows him to take home an income every day.  Erasmo is hard-working, honest and responsible.  He lives with his family - his wife and four children, aged 19, 17, ten and six years.  Erasmo works very hard alongside his wife in order for the family to prosper and to improve their living conditions.  Thanks to his knowledge of agriculture, his main source of income, Eramso is able to support the household.  This is the only way he knows to earn an honest living.  With a great desire to overcome problems, Erasmo has decdied to applying for a loan in order to buy necessary supplies such as seeds, manure and insecticides for the sowing season.  Erasmo trusts in God and in his work that, with the help of this loan, he will have an abundant harvest that will allow him and his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticides and more.

loans.name: Mario Edgardo

texts.es: Mario de 40 años de edad, habita en su vivienda junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y sorgo. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 20 años de su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mario is 40 years old. He lies in his home with his wife and 3 children. He works in farming, growing corn and sorghum. He has done this activity for 20 years and that is how he earns his daily bread. He is a hardworking, responsible man who is very well known in his area for his enormous heart and kindness to others. Since it is planting season he has made the decision to start to get ready. That is why he has decided to ask for this new loan from  INTEGRAL to invest in buying seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, etc. What he wants the most is for his harvest to be abundant and better than the previous ones, since this is how he supports his family. He trusts in God that with His help, his hard work and dedication at work will make his dream of improving his family's quality of life come true.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Doña Ada de 51 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene 10 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, abonos, fertilizantes, etc.  doña Ada  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Ada is 51 years old. She lives with her life's companion in a house she owns. She grows corn and sorghum and has worked in agriculture for 10 years. This has given her a lot of experience that allows her to obtain better harvests. She sells her harvests in the areas surrounding her community, since she has a lot of customers who prefer her for the quality, the good prices and above all the good service. She needs to invest and that is why she has asked for a loan that will allow her to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, manure, fertilizer, etc. Ada has good credit references from her acquaintances and she is very responsible. She assures us she can pay off the debt on time and trusts she will bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su esposo en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo desde hace 3 años siembra maíz y maicillo con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. y poder seguir con su trabajo y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This client lives with her husband in a home she owns. She has worked as a farmer for 3 years. She grows corn and sorghum . With the profits she makes from her sales and with her husband's help, she is able to pay for the household expenses. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicide, etc. and be able to continue with her work and give her family what they need without limits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Serapia Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 55 años de edad y es soltera, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra cebada, avena, habas,etc. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes.  

(La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Teodora was born in the community of Cotañi and still lives there. She is 55 years old and single. Teodora is a hardworking and enterprising person who has been able to get ahead with a great deal of effort and work. Farming is her main business activity and she has several plots of land on which she grows barley, oats, beans, and other crops. Teodora also raises small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Sumaq Paqari” for several years and is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more guinea pigs.

The community of Cotañi is part of the District of Huancarani in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio, solicita un nuevo préstamo, ya que estos son un buen recurso financiero para salir adelante; este le permitirá comprar seis quintales de abono y dos galones de  insecticidas, asimismo concentrado para cerdos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a generar ingresos y una bueno producción en las cosechas de maíz, frijol, entre otros;  las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rogelio is requesting a new loan since this is a good financial resource that will help him move forward. The loan will enable him to buy six “quintales” (1 quintal = 100 kg) of compost and two gallons of insecticides. He will also buy concentrated pig feed.

Rogelio’s previous loan helped him to generate income and achieve good production with his crops of corn, beans, and other produce. His financial condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, and concentrated pig feed.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling coconuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy more coconut fruit to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 15 years. She earns extra income from a general store.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of purchasing a vehicle for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more coconut fruit to sell.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 55-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two school aged children. Najah has faced bad circumstances and lived in unpleasant financial conditions. This is why she works hard to show her perseverance of being able to enhance her family’s way of living and support her husband with the family expenses. In 2005, she started selling clothes. She has her own shop that is located at a very strategic point. She offers a great variety of clothes at fair prices. This will be her first Kiva loan and she expects to obtain great results. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her merchandise and follow the new fashions. This is how Najah works every day to better develop her business and earn higher revenues.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise and follow the new fashions.

loans.name: Sayidat Al Najat Group

texts.en:
Souad is the featured borrower on Sayidat Al Najat's Group; she agreed with the other group members to apply for their 37th loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Souad is a 69-year-old widowed mother of one child whom she spent her whole life working hard to provide with the best education and living conditions. 

Souad works in the mouneh business; she is specialized in preparing conserved food from one season to another to sell for her family's living.

Mouneh is a traditional way of conserving food from one season to another, it includes vine leaves, special fruit jams, and the famous Lebanese traditional "kishek," which is prepared during the summer season to be consumed during the winter season. It is a food that warms people during cold days.

Kishek is a mixture of yogurt and grit, completely mixed together and spread on a big piece of cloth on a roof top or an open space and covered with another cloth, directly exposed to sunlight to dry. Then they are ground to be conserved as powder, which is cooked with minced meat, garlic, onion and water and served as thick soup, especially during the winter season.

Souad's business needs hard work and effort, but she is an expert in it. Her loan will help her buy the requested materials to make these foods. She is the first one from the left.

Zeina is the second from the left. She is a 47-year-old married woman, the mother of three children. She owns a convenience store which is well-known in her region. Her loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special summer beverages and offers.

Ayda is the one in the middle with the green scarf. She is a 45-year-old married woman, the mother of five children. She sells clothes to help her husband in making their living. The loan will be invested in buying a new summer collection.

Nisrine is the second from the right; she is a 35-year-old married woman, the mother of four children. She works as a housekeeper to help her husband in raising her family and covering their expenses.

Her requested loan will be invested in paying for her children's school fees.

Georjina is a 35-year-old married woman, the mother of two children. She sells beauty cosmetics to help her husband in their living. The requested loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special summer collection and requesting special conserved food to be consumed during the winter season.

loans.use: to buy the requested materials for the requested foods to be conserved

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a single, 41-year-old woman who resides in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines. Jocelyn has managed a garden for 5 years, where she plants vegetables to earn a living. Aside from farming, she also owns a retail store selling RTW products. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase RTW products to sell. In the future, Jocelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase RTW products.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en: Juvita is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in a rented store selling vegetables. She is making a good income from selling vegetables, and she wants to buy more inventory with the loan. She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she sells every day. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with working capital of 250.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Kadamshoh

texts.en: Kadamshoh is married and has 5 children. He is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for his children. Kadamshoh began his own business dealing in animal husbandry 7 years ago. He cares for cattle and then sells them at the local market. He has requested a loan in the amount of $1100 to increase the number of animals cares for. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is a 35-year-old married mom with five children.
To make a living, Maribel plants, harvests, and sells vegetables to the local community.  She has done this for 5 years and earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.
Maribel is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and to pay weeding labor costs. Maribel has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay weeding labor costs.
